                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p5.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p5.m5.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\DiffIm</ERROR>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p5.m5.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p5.m5.2">M</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is continuous in <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S2.p5.m6">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The phase space of the subshift is called the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">base</text> of the skew product, the manifold <Math mode="inline" tex="M" text="M" xml:id="S2.p5.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">fiber</text>, and the maps <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\om}" text="f _ [\om]" xml:id="S2.p5.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are called the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">fiber maps</text>. <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">The fiber over <Math mode="inline" tex="\omega" text="omega" xml:id="S2.p5.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math></text> is the set <Math mode="inline" tex="M_{\om}:=\{\omega\}\times M\subset\Sigma\times M" text="M _ [\om] assign set@(omega) * M subset-of Sigma * M" xml:id="S2.p5.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p5.m10.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p5.m10.1">ω</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p6">
      <p>In any argument about the geometry of the skew products we always assume that the base factor of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma\times M" text="Sigma * M" xml:id="S2.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is “horizontal” and the fiber factor is “vertical”.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p7">
      <p>A skew product over a subshift of finite type is a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">step skew product</text> if the fiber maps <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\om}" text="f _ [\om]" xml:id="S2.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> depend only on the position <Math mode="inline" tex="\om_{0}" text="[\om] _ 0" xml:id="S2.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S2.p7.m3">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. For the general skew products (fiber maps depend on the whole sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S2.p7.m4">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math>) we sometimes use the word <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">mild</text>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p8">
      <p>The fiber <Math mode="inline" tex="M" text="M" xml:id="S2.p8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is always the unit interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I=[0,1]" text="I = closed-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S2.p8.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p8.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p8.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p8.m2.1">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p8.m2.2">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the maps <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\om}\colon I\to f_{\om}(I)" text="f _ [\om] colon I to f _ [\om] * I" xml:id="S2.p8.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p8.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p8.m3.1">I</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
take the interval strictly inside itself. They also preserve the orientation, i.e., are strictly increasing. Suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="\sP" text="[\sP]" xml:id="S2.p8.m4">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\sP</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the set of all such skew products and <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcS\subset\sP" text="[\mcS] subset-of [\sP]" xml:id="S2.p8.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcS</ERROR>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\sP</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the subset of all step skew products. Note that <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcS" text="[\mcS]" xml:id="S2.p8.m6">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\mcS</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the Cartesian product of <Math mode="inline" tex="N" text="N" xml:id="S2.p8.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> copies of <Math mode="inline" tex="\DiffIm^{1}(I)" text="[\DiffIm] ^ 1 * I" xml:id="S2.p8.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\DiffIm</ERROR>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p8.m8.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p8.m8.1">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. We endow <Math mode="inline" tex="\sP" text="[\sP]" xml:id="S2.p8.m9">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\sP</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with the metric</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex3">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\dist_{\sP}(F,G):=\sup_{\om}(\dist_{C^{1}}(f_{\om}^{\pm 1},g_{\om}^{\pm 1}))." text="[\dist] _ [\sP] * open-interval@(F, G) assign (supremum _ [\om])@([\dist] _ (C ^ 1) * open-interval@((f _ [\om]) ^ (plus-or-minus 1), (g _ [\om]) ^ (plus-or-minus 1)))" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.3"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\dist</ERROR>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\sP</ERROR>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.1">F</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.2">G</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.3.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <ERROR class="undefined">\dist</ERROR>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.3.1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex3.m1.3.1.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.3.1.1">
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                                  <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex3.m1.3.1.2">
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                                  <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus-or-minus" name="pm" role="ADDOP">±</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>This induces the <Math mode="inline" tex="\max" text="maximum" xml:id="S2.p8.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">max</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-metric of a product on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcS" text="[\mcS]" xml:id="S2.p8.m11">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\mcS</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
In this paper, we consider only step skew products. We describe the dynamics of a generic <Math mode="inline" tex="F\in\mcS" text="F element-of [\mcS]" xml:id="S2.p8.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcS</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p9">
      <p>In the rest of this text, all measures are assumed to be probabilities.
<!--  %**** String Line 150 **** -->Like any dynamical system on a compact metric space, the subshift <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S2.p9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has a non-empty set of invariant measures. There is a natural class of them called <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">Markov measures</text>. They are defined as follows.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p10">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi=(\pi_{ij})_{i,j=1}^{N}" text="Pi = (pi _ (i * j) _ (list@(i, j) = 1)) ^ N" xml:id="S2.p10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m1.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.p10.m1.3">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m1.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m1.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p10.m1.1">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p10.m1.2">j</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{ij}\in[0,1]" text="pi _ (i * j) element-of closed-interval@(0, 1)" xml:id="S2.p10.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p10.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p10.m2.1">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p10.m2.2">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be a right stochastic matrix (i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="\forall i" text="for-all@(i)" xml:id="S2.p10.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="for-all" name="forall" role="BIGOP">∀</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{j}\pi_{ij}=1" text="(sum _ j)@(pi _ (i * j)) = 1" xml:id="S2.p10.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>) such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{ij}=0" text="pi _ (i * j) = 0" xml:id="S2.p10.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> iff <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{ij}=0" text="a _ (i * j) = 0" xml:id="S2.p10.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p10.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be its eigenvector with non-negative components that corresponds to the eigenvalue <Math mode="inline" tex="1" text="1" xml:id="S2.p10.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>:</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:e:vector_p" xml:id="S2.E2">
        <tags>
          <tag>(2)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="\forall i\;p_{i}\geq 0,\text{ and }\sum_{i}\pi_{ij}p_{i}=p_{j}." text="formulae@(for-all@(i * p _ i) &gt;= 0, [ and ] * (sum _ i)@(pi _ (i * j) * p _ i) = p _ j)" xml:id="S2.E2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S2.E2.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMDual xml:id="S2.E2.m1.1">
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.E2.m1.1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.E2.m1.1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.E2.m1.1.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="for-all" name="forall" role="BIGOP">∀</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="2.8pt">i</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.E2.m1.1.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMText> and </XMText>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>We can always assume <Math mode="inline" tex="\sum_{i}p_{i}=1" text="(sum _ i)@(p _ i) = 1" xml:id="S2.p10.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p11">
      <p>For any finite word <Math mode="inline" tex="\om_{k}\ldots\om_{m}" text="[\om] _ k * ldots * [\om] _ m" xml:id="S2.p11.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="k,m\in\bbZ" text="list@(k, m) element-of [\bbZ]" xml:id="S2.p11.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p11.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p11.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p11.m2.1">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p11.m2.2">m</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\bbZ</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="k\leq m" text="k less= m" xml:id="S2.p11.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> we consider a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">cylinder</text></p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex4">
        <Math mode="display" tex="C_{w}:=\{\om^{\prime}\in\Sigma\mid\om_{k}^{\prime}=\om_{k},\ldots,\om_{m}^{%&#10;\prime}=\om_{m}\}." text="C _ w assign conditional-set@([\om] ^ prime element-of Sigma, formulae@(([\om] _ k) ^ prime = list@([\om] _ k, ldots), ([\om] _ m) ^ prime = [\om] _ m))" xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex4.m1.2"/>

                      <XMDual xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.2.2">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>

                            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                              <XMApp>

                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex4.m1.2.2.1.1">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                                </XMApp>

                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

                            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                              </XMApp>

                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>

                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>The cylinders form a countable base of the topology on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma" text="Sigma" xml:id="S2.p11.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Thus a Borel measure on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma" text="Sigma" xml:id="S2.p11.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is properly defined by its values on every cylinder.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p12">
      <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.p12.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">Markov measure</text> constructed from the distribution <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{i}" text="p _ i" xml:id="S2.p12.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the transition probabilities <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{ij}" text="pi _ (i * j)" xml:id="S2.p12.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if its values on the cylinders are:</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:e:markov_measure" xml:id="S2.E3">

          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p13">
      <p>It is easy to see that the formula (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:markov_measure"/>) is consistent on the set of all cylinders. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.p13.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is well-defined. Moreover, it is invariant under the shift map <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma" text="sigma" xml:id="S2.p13.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Note that for any stochastic matrix <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi" text="Pi" xml:id="S2.p13.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> there exists at least one vector <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S2.p13.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> satisfying (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:vector_p"/>). Such a vector is unique whenever the subshift is transitive and <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{ij}\neq 0\Leftrightarrow a_{ij}\neq 0" text="pi _ (i * j) not-equals 0 Leftrightarrow a _ (i * j) not-equals 0" xml:id="S2.p13.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="Leftrightarrow" role="METARELOP">⇔</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> (as in our case). If that is so, the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.p13.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is ergodic; <Math mode="inline" tex="\supp\nu" text="[\supp] * nu" xml:id="S2.p13.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\supp</ERROR>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> coincides with <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma" text="Sigma" xml:id="S2.p13.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p14">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.p14.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be any ergodic Markov measure on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma" text="Sigma" xml:id="S2.p14.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. From now on, the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.p14.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is fixed.
<ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR> 
<!--  %**** String Line 175 **** -->The <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">standard measure</text> <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{s}" text="s" xml:id="S2.p14.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">s</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma\times I" text="Sigma * I" xml:id="S2.p14.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the product of <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.p14.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the Lebesgue measure on the fiber.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p15">
      <p>Our goal is to give the description of the behavior of almost every orbit w.r.t. the standard measure. Such a description is given by Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/> below. This is the main result of this paper.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p16">
      <p>We say that a closed set in the skew product is a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">bony graph</text> if it
intersects almost every fiber (w.r.t. <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.p16.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>) at a single point, and any
other fiber at an interval (a “bone”).</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p17">
      <p>The name comes from the following simple observation. Any bony graph can be represented as a disjoint union of two sets, <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S2.p17.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p17.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S2.p17.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denotes the union of the bones. The projection of <Math mode="inline" tex="K" text="K" xml:id="S2.p17.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S2.p17.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma" text="Sigma" xml:id="S2.p17.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has zero measure, while <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p17.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the graph of some measurable function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi:\Sigma\setminus h(K)\to I" text="varphi colon Sigma set-minus h * K to I" xml:id="S2.p17.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p17.m8.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p17.m8.1">K</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. By Fubini’s Theorem, the standard measure of a bony graph is zero.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p18">
      <p>For any set <Math mode="inline" tex="B" text="B" xml:id="S2.p18.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, denote <Math mode="inline" tex="B_{\om}:=B\cap I_{\om}" text="B _ [\om] assign B intersection I _ [\om]" xml:id="S2.p18.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
<ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR> 
A bony graph <Math mode="inline" tex="B" text="B" xml:id="S2.p18.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">continuous-bony graph (CBG)</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="B_{\om}" text="B _ [\om]" xml:id="S2.p18.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is upper-semicontinuous:</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex5">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\forall\om\,\forall\eps&gt;0\quad\exists\delta&gt;0\quad\text{ such that }\quad\dist%&#10;(\om,\om^{\prime})&lt;\delta\Rightarrow B_{\om^{\prime}}\subset U_{\eps}(B_{\om})." text="formulae@(for-all@([\om] * for-all@([\eps])) &gt; 0, formulae@(exists@(delta) &gt; list@(0, [ such that ]), [\dist] * open-interval@([\om], [\om] ^ prime) less delta Rightarrow B _ ([\om] ^ prime) subset-of U _ [\eps] * B _ [\om]))" xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.4"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMDual xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1.4">
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.Ex5.m1.4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.Ex5.m1.4.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="for-all" name="forall" role="BIGOP">∀</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="for-all" name="forall" role="BIGOP">∀</XMTok>

            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p19">
      <p>In particular, the graph part <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p19.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a graph of a function which is continuous on its domain.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p20">
      <p>In Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/>, we show that the attractors and the repellers of generic skew products are CBGs. They are also <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S2.p20.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant. It is easy to see that the restriction of the dynamics to an invariant CBG is very much the same as the restriction to the base:</p>
    </para>
<!--  %**** String Line 200 **** -->    <ERROR class="undefined">{Prop}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p21">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="B" text="B" xml:id="S2.p21.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be an invariant CBG.
Then the vertical projection <Math mode="inline" tex="h\colon B\setminus K\to\Sigma\setminus h(K)" text="h colon B set-minus K to Sigma set-minus h * K" xml:id="S2.p21.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.p21.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p21.m2.1">K</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a homeomorphism conjugating the dynamics of <Math mode="inline" tex="F|_{B\setminus K}" text="evaluated-at@(F, B set-minus K)" xml:id="S2.p21.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>

                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p21.m3.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p21.m3.2">
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">K</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma|_{\Sigma\setminus h(K)}" text="evaluated-at@(sigma, Sigma set-minus h * K)" xml:id="S2.p21.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>

    <para xml:id="S2.p22">
      <p>The following geometrical notions are crucial for our reasoning.
Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{i}\colon\Sigma\to I" text="varphi _ i colon Sigma to I" xml:id="S2.p22.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>

                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be two arbitrary functions, <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma(\varphi_{i})" text="Gamma * varphi _ i" xml:id="S2.p22.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be their graphs, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,2" text="i = list@(1, 2)" xml:id="S2.p22.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                  <XMRef idref="S2.p22.m3.2"/>

                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S2.p22.m3.1">1</XMTok>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>

    <para xml:id="S2.p24">
      <p>This definition admits a natural extension to the case of bony graphs:
<ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR> 
Let <Math mode="inline" tex="B_{1},B_{2}" text="list@(B _ 1, B _ 2)" xml:id="S2.p24.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p24.m1.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p24.m1.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p24.m1.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p24.m1.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be two bony graphs. We write <Math mode="inline" tex="B_{1}&lt;B_{2}" text="B _ 1 less B _ 2" xml:id="S2.p24.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if for any <Math mode="inline" tex="(\om,x_{1})\in B_{1}" text="open-interval@([\om], x _ 1) element-of B _ 1" xml:id="S2.p24.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p24.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p24.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S2.p24.m3.1">\om</ERROR>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p24.m3.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="(\om,x_{2})\in B_{2}" text="open-interval@([\om], x _ 2) element-of B _ 2" xml:id="S2.p24.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p24.m4.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p24.m4.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S2.p24.m4.1">\om</ERROR>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p24.m4.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> we have <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{1}&lt;x_{2}" text="x _ 1 less x _ 2" xml:id="S2.p24.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p25">
      <p>Recall that a skew product permutes the fibers. Thus the image <Math mode="inline" tex="F(\Gamma)" text="F * Gamma" xml:id="S2.p25.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p25.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p25.m1.1">Γ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of any graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p25.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is also a graph of some function.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p26">
      <p>We say that a graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.p26.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">drifts up (down)</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="F(\Gamma)&gt;\Gamma" text="F * Gamma &gt; Gamma" xml:id="S2.p26.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p26.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p26.m2.1">Γ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> (respectively, <Math mode="inline" tex="F(\Gamma)&lt;\Gamma" text="F * Gamma less Gamma" xml:id="S2.p26.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p26.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p26.m3.1">Γ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>).
<!--  %**** String Line 225 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p27">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}\colon\Sigma\to I" text="list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2) colon Sigma to I" xml:id="S2.p27.m1">

              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>

                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be continuous functions such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{1}&lt;\varphi_{2}" text="varphi _ 1 less varphi _ 2" xml:id="S2.p27.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The set</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex7">

      </equation>
      <p>is called the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">strip between the graphs of <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{1}" text="varphi _ 1" xml:id="S2.p27.m3">

    <para xml:id="S2.p28">
      <p>The strip <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}}" text="S _ (list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2))" xml:id="S2.p28.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p28.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">trapping (nonstrictly trapping)</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="F(S_{\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}})\subset\inter S_{\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}}" text="F * S _ (list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2)) subset-of [\inter] * S _ (list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2))" xml:id="S2.p28.m2">
          <XMath>

                  <XMRef idref="S2.p28.m2.5"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                        <XMApp>

              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>

                  <XMRef idref="S2.p28.m3.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p28.m3.4"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p28.m3.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p28.m3.4">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The strip is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">inverse trapping</text> (<text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">nonstrictly inverse trapping</text>) if the same holds true for <Math mode="inline" tex="F^{-1}" text="F ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S2.p28.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p29">
      <p>Because the fiber maps are monotonous, <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{1}&lt;\varphi_{2}" text="varphi _ 1 less varphi _ 2" xml:id="S2.p29.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> implies the inequality <Math mode="inline" tex="F^{n}(\varphi_{1})&lt;F^{n}(\varphi_{2})" text="F ^ n * varphi _ 1 less F ^ n * varphi _ 2" xml:id="S2.p29.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m2.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m2.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for any <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 0" text="n &gt;= 0" xml:id="S2.p29.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. This is also true for any <Math mode="inline" tex="n&lt;0" text="n less 0" xml:id="S2.p29.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, provided that the preimages of the graphs are well-defined. Thus for any <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 0" text="n &gt;= 0" xml:id="S2.p29.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the image <Math mode="inline" tex="F^{n}(S_{\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}})" text="F ^ n * S _ (list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2))" xml:id="S2.p29.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m6.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m6.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m6.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m6.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m6.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m6.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is also a (non-empty) strip.
In particular, because <Math mode="inline" tex="F(S_{\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}})\subset S_{\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}}" text="F * S _ (list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2)) subset-of S _ (list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2))" xml:id="S2.p29.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m7.5"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m7.5">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m7.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m7.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m7.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m7.2">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m7.3"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S2.p29.m7.4"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m7.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S2.p29.m7.4">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, any trapping strip has a non-empty <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">maximal attractor</text>:</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:e:Amax" xml:id="S2.E4">
        <tags>
          <tag>(4)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
        </tags>

                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">

                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>

                        <XMApp>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S2.E4.m1.5.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>

                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                                <XMRef idref="S2.E4.m1.4"/>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S2.E4.m1.3">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
