                                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S2.E4.m1.4">
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>In Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/> we show that for a generic skew product the maximal attractor of any trapping strip is a CBG, provided the strip is indecomposable in a certain sense .</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p30">
      <p>Among all invariant measures of a smooth dynamical system, the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">physical</text>, or <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">SRB</text> (for Sinai, Ruelle, and Bowen) measures are of particular interest. See, for instance, the handbook <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Barreira2006" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>. The following definition dates back to the classical papers <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Sinai1972,Ruelle1976,Bowen2008" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>:
<ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
<!--  %**** String Line 250 **** -->Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}" text="m" xml:id="S2.p30.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be an <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S2.p30.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-invariant measure. Consider the set <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S2.p30.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of all points <Math mode="inline" tex="p\in X" text="p element-of X" xml:id="S2.p30.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such that for any function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi\in C(\Sigma\times I)" text="varphi element-of C * Sigma * I" xml:id="S2.p30.m5">
          <XMath>

                  <XMWrap>

                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the time average is equal to the space average:</p>
      <equation xml:id="S2.Ex8">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\lim\limits_{n\to\infty}\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=0}^{n-1}\varphi(F^{i}(p))=\int%&#10;\limits_{\Sigma\times I}\varphi\,d\mathbf{m}." text="(limit _ (n to infinity))@((1 / n) * ((sum _ (i = 0)) ^ (n - 1))@(varphi * F ^ i * p)) = (integral _ (Sigma * I))@(varphi * differential-d@(m))" xml:id="S2.Ex8.m1">

                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>

                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" meaning="differential-d" role="DIFFOP">d</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}" text="m" xml:id="S2.p30.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">physical measure</text> if the set <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S2.p30.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has a positive standard measure. The set <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S2.p30.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is then called its <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">basin</text>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p31">
      <p>It turns out that in our case the following stronger property holds. The basin of any physical measure is a full-measure subset of an open subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.p31.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p32">
      <p>In general, very few invariant measures are physical. A long-standing open question asks if the attractors of typical dynamical systems carry physical measures (see, for instance, the review <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Palis2005" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>). In his paper <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ruelle1976" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, Ruelle proved that uniformly hyperbolic attractors do. In our case the attractors are partially hyperbolic instead, but we also manage to prove the existence of physical measures for them.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p33">
      <p>The main result of the paper is the following</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Thm}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p34">
      <p>For a generic <Math mode="inline" tex="F\in\mcS" text="F element-of [\mcS]" xml:id="S2.p34.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcS</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> there is a finite collection of trapping strips and inverse trapping strips such that</p>
      <enumerate xml:id="S2.I1">
        <item labels="LABEL:t:markov_classification:0.5" xml:id="S2.I1.i1">
          <tags>
            <tag>(1)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S2.I1.i1.p1">
            <p>their union is the whole phase space <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S2.I1.i1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:t:markov_classification:1" xml:id="S2.I1.i2">
          <tags>
            <tag>(2)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S2.I1.i2.p1">
            <p>the maximal attractors (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:Amax"/>) of the trapping strips are CBGs; the repellers (i.e., the maximal attractors for the inverse map) of every inverse trapping strip are also CBGs;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:t:markov_classification:2" xml:id="S2.I1.i3">
          <tags>
            <tag>(3)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 3</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S2.I1.i3.p1">
            <p>any trapping strip and any inverse trapping strip has a unique ergodic invariant measure such that its projection to the base is the Markov measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.I1.i3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Namely, it is the lift of <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.I1.i3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> onto the attractor (or repeller) considered as the graph of a function defined almost everywhere. This measure is physical. Its basin contains a subset of full measure of the strip;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:t:markov_classification:2.5" xml:id="S2.I1.i4">
          <tags>
            <tag>(4)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 4</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1">
            <p>for any trapping strip, there exists an invariant subset <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of full measure (w.r.t. the measure from <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:2"/>) of its maximal attractor such that <Math mode="inline" tex="h\Gamma\subset\Sigma" text="h * Gamma subset-of Sigma" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is a invariant residual subset of full measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. The vertical projection <Math mode="inline" tex="h" text="h" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> conjugates the restrictions <Math mode="inline" tex="F|_{\Gamma}" text="evaluated-at@(F, Gamma)" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.I1.i4.p1.m5.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.I1.i4.p1.m5.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m5.1">F</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m5.2">Γ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma|_{h\Gamma}" text="evaluated-at@(sigma, h * Gamma)" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.I1.i4.p1.m6.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S2.I1.i4.p1.m6.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m6.1">σ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m6.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.
Note that <Math mode="inline" tex="h\Gamma" text="h * Gamma" xml:id="S2.I1.i4.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is not closed but is invariant;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:t:markov_classification:3" xml:id="S2.I1.i5">
          <tags>
            <tag>(5)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">5</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 5</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S2.I1.i5.p1">
            <p>the fiber-wise Lyapunov exponents of the attractor and repeller measures from <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:2"/> are non-zero;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:t:markov_classification:4" xml:id="S2.I1.i6">
          <tags>
            <tag>(6)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">6</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 6</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S2.I1.i6.p1">
            <p>the graphs of the attractors and repellers are mutually comparable in the sense of Definition <ref labelref="LABEL:def:compare"/>. Moreover, the attractors and the repellers are alternating: <Math mode="inline" tex="\dots&lt;A_{1}&lt;R_{1}&lt;A_{2}&lt;R_{2}&lt;\dots" text="dots less A _ 1 less R _ 1 less A _ 2 less R _ 2 less dots" xml:id="S2.I1.i6.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </enumerate>
<!--  %**** String Line 275 **** -->    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p35">
      <p>Here the set of all generic skew products is an open and dense subset of the space of all step skew products.
In Section <ref labelref="LABEL:s:typicalness"/> we explicitly state the genericity conditions.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p36">
      <p>We also provide an upper bound for the number of attractors and repellers, see Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:p:att_num"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S2.p37">
      <p>One may consider the following generalization of step skew products. Let the fiber maps <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\om}" text="f _ [\om]" xml:id="S2.p37.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> depend on finitely many symbols <Math mode="inline" tex="(\om_{-k}\ldots\om_{l})" text="[\om] _ (- k) * ldots * [\om] _ l" xml:id="S2.p37.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S2.p37.m2.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S2.p37.m2.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="k,l\in\bbN" text="list@(k, l) element-of [\bbN]" xml:id="S2.p37.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p37.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S2.p37.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p37.m3.1">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S2.p37.m3.2">l</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\bbN</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, rather than on a single symbol. We call such systems <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">multistep skew products</text>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S2.p38">
      <p>The statements of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/> also hold for generic multistep skew products. Indeed,
any multistep skew product <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S2.p38.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be replaced by the step skew product <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.p38.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> which base Markov states are the admissible words of length <Math mode="inline" tex="k+l+1" text="k + l + 1" xml:id="S2.p38.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the base Markov chain of <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S2.p38.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
Note that the base Markov chain of <Math mode="inline" tex="G" text="G" xml:id="S2.p38.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is transitive if <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S2.p38.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>’s one is.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:prop:meas_1_to_2 LABEL:s:one-sided" xml:id="S3">
    <tags>
      <tag>3</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§3</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">3</tag>Skew products over one-sided shifts</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">3</tag>Skew products over one-sided shifts</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S3.p1">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma_{+}" text="Sigma _ +" xml:id="S3.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be the space of unilateral (infinite to the right) sequences <Math mode="inline" tex="\omega=(\omega_{n})_{0}^{+\infty}" text="omega = (omega _ n _ 0) ^ (+ infinity)" xml:id="S3.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.p1.m2.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> satisfying <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{\om_{n}\om_{n+1}}=1" text="a _ ([\om] _ n * [\om] _ (n + 1)) = 1" xml:id="S3.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for all <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S3.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The left shift <Math mode="inline" tex="\sigma_{+}\colon\Sigma_{+}\to\Sigma_{+},\;(\sigma_{+}\om)_{n}=\om_{n+1}" text="sigma _ + colon formulae@(Sigma _ + to Sigma _ +, (sigma _ + * [\om]) _ n = [\om] _ (n + 1))" xml:id="S3.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m5.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p1.m5.1">
                    <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="2.8pt">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p1.m5.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m5.2.1"/>

                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.p1.m5.2.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                            </XMApp>

                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> defines a non-invertible dynamical system on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma_{+}" text="Sigma _ +" xml:id="S3.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The system <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Sigma_{+},\sigma_{+})" text="open-interval@(Sigma _ +, sigma _ +)" xml:id="S3.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m7.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m7.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S3.p1.m7.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S3.p1.m7.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a factor of the system <Math mode="inline" tex="(\Sigma,\sigma)" text="open-interval@(Sigma, sigma)" xml:id="S3.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m8.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m8.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p1.m8.1">Σ</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p1.m8.2">σ</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> under the “forgetting the past” map <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi\colon(\om_{n})_{-\infty}^{+\infty}\mapsto(\om_{n})_{0}^{+\infty}" text="pi colon ([\om] _ n _ (- infinity)) ^ (+ infinity) maps-to ([\om] _ n _ 0) ^ (+ infinity)" xml:id="S3.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.p1.m9.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

    <para xml:id="S3.p2">
      <p>Formulae (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:markov_metric"/>) and (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:markov_measure"/>) define the metric and the invariant measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu_{+}" text="nu _ +" xml:id="S3.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma_{+}" text="Sigma _ +" xml:id="S3.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. A measure is called <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">invariant</text> under a non-invertible map <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{+}" text="F _ +" xml:id="S3.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> if for any measurable set <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S3.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>

    <para xml:id="S3.p3">
      <p>Recall that in a step skew product over the two-sided Markov shift the fiberwise maps depend only on <Math mode="inline" tex="\om_{0}" text="[\om] _ 0" xml:id="S3.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Thus one can pass from the skew product to the quotient:</p>

    <para xml:id="S3.p4">
      <p>There is a relation between the invariant measures of <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S3.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>

<ERROR class="undefined">{Prop}</ERROR></p>
      <enumerate xml:id="S3.I1">
        <item xml:id="S3.I1.i1">
          <tags>
            <tag>(1)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S3.I1.i1.p1">
            <p>For any <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S3.I1.i1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-invariant measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}" text="m" xml:id="S3.I1.i1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> its projection <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}=\pi_{*}\mathbf{m}" text="m _ + = pi _ * * m" xml:id="S3.I1.i1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>,</p>
            <equation xml:id="S3.Ex10">
              <Math mode="display" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}(A):=\mathbf{m}(\pi^{-1}(A))," text="m _ + * A assign m * pi ^ (- 1) * A" xml:id="S3.Ex10.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Ex10.m1.3"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex10.m1.3">
                        <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>

                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.Ex10.m1.3.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex10.m1.3.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S3.Ex10.m1.2"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Ex10.m1.2">A</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 325 **** -->                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
            </equation>
            <p>is <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{+}" text="F _ +" xml:id="S3.I1.i1.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-invariant;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item xml:id="S3.I1.i2">
          <tags>
            <tag>(2)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S3.I1.i2.p1">
            <p>For any <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{+}" text="F _ +" xml:id="S3.I1.i2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-invariant measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}" text="m _ +" xml:id="S3.I1.i2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> there exists an <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S3.I1.i2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-invariant measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}" text="m" xml:id="S3.I1.i2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}=\pi_{*}\mathbf{m}" text="m _ + = pi _ * * m" xml:id="S3.I1.i2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </enumerate>
    </para>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S3.p5">
        <p>The first statement follows immediately from (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:skew-factor"/>). To prove the second one, take an arbitrary measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathbf{m}}" text="bar@(m)" xml:id="S3.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma\times I" text="Sigma * I" xml:id="S3.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}=\pi_{*}\bar{\mathbf{m}}" text="m _ + = pi _ * * bar@(m)" xml:id="S3.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Applying the Krylov-Bogolyubov averaging procedure <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Krylov1947" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> to <Math mode="inline" tex="\bar{\mathbf{m}}" text="bar@(m)" xml:id="S3.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="bar" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">¯</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, we obtain an <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S3.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}" text="m" xml:id="S3.p5.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. And as the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}" text="m _ +" xml:id="S3.p5.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{+}" text="F _ +" xml:id="S3.p5.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant, (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:skew-factor"/>) implies that the projection of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}" text="m" xml:id="S3.p5.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is also equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}" text="m _ +" xml:id="S3.p5.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:d:stationary LABEL:def:perehod LABEL:p:absorb LABEL:s:random_markov LABEL:t:random" xml:id="S4">
    <tags>
      <tag>4</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§4</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">4</tag>Stationary measures of random walks</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">4</tag>Stationary measures of random walks</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S4.p1">
      <p>We assign a random walk to any one-sided skew product, as follows. Imagine that we are tracking the <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{+}" text="F _ +" xml:id="S4.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-iterations of a point <Math mode="inline" tex="(\om,x)\in\Sigma_{+}\times I" text="open-interval@([\om], x) element-of Sigma _ + * I" xml:id="S4.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S4.p1.m2.1">\om</ERROR>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p1.m2.2">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, where <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S4.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is chosen randomly with respect to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S4.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. But we can only observe its <Math mode="inline" tex="I" text="I" xml:id="S4.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-coordinate and the symbol <Math mode="inline" tex="\om_{0}" text="[\om] _ 0" xml:id="S4.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Then the sequence of our observations is a realization of a discrete Markov process <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S4.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m7.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p1.m7.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on the space <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI=\{1,\dots,N\}\times I" text="[\mcI] = set@(1, dots, N) * I" xml:id="S4.p1.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m8.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m8.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m8.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.p1.m8.1">1</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S4.p1.m8.2">…</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p1.m8.3">N</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The transition probability from a point <Math mode="inline" tex="(i,x)" text="open-interval@(i, x)" xml:id="S4.p1.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m9.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m9.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p1.m9.1">i</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p1.m9.2">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to a point <Math mode="inline" tex="(j,f_{i}(x))" text="open-interval@(j, f _ i * x)" xml:id="S4.p1.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m10.2"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m10.3"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p1.m10.2">j</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S4.p1.m10.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p1.m10.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p1.m10.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> equals <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{ij}" text="pi _ (i * j)" xml:id="S4.p1.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S4.p2">
      <p>For any measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S4.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on the space <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI" text="[\mcI]" xml:id="S4.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, it is natural to denote its stochastic image <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{*}\mu" text="f _ * * mu" xml:id="S4.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:e:stoch_img" xml:id="S4.E7">
        <tags>
          <tag>(7)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="(f_{*}\mu)_{j}:=\sum_{i}\pi_{ij}\cdot(f_{j})_{*}\mu_{i}," text="(f _ * * mu) _ j assign (sum _ i)@((pi _ (i * j) cdot f _ j _ *) * mu _ i)" xml:id="S4.E7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S4.E7.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S4.E7.m1.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S4.E7.m1.1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S4.E7.m1.1.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                      <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S4.E7.m1.1.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S4.E7.m1.1.2">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{i}" text="mu _ i" xml:id="S4.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the restriction of the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S4.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to the interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{i}=\{i\}\times I" text="I _ i = set@(i) * I" xml:id="S4.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p2.m6.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p2.m6.1">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S4.p3">
      <p>A measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S4.p3.m1">
          <XMath>

          <XMath>

        </Math> is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">stationary</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{*}\mu=\mu" text="f _ * * mu = mu" xml:id="S4.p3.m3">
          <XMath>

                </XMApp>

        </Math>.</p>

<!--  %**** String Line 350 **** -->    <para xml:id="S4.p4">
      <p>Similarly to the invariant measures of dynamical systems, any stationary measure of a random processes admits a decomposition into an integral over <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">ergodic</text> stationary measures, thus they are most important to study.</p>
    </para>

    <para xml:id="S4.p6">
      <p>On the other hand, Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:meas_1_to_2"/> establishes a relation between invariant measures of <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{+}" text="F _ +" xml:id="S4.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S4.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
In Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:p:meas_on_limit"/> below we show that the “attractor” measures (see claim <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:2"/> of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/>) are projected under <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S4.p6.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-factorization to the measures of type (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:inv_measure"/>) which correspond to the stationary measures of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S4.p6.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p6.m4.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p6.m4.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
However, the “repeller” invariant measures are mapped under <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S4.p6.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-factorization to measures which are supported on CBGs themselves. So, to study these measures, we will pass from <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S4.p6.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to the inverse skew product <Math mode="inline" tex="F^{-1}" text="F ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S4.p6.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S4.p7">
      <p>A pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(k,m)" text="open-interval@(k, m)" xml:id="S4.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m1.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p7.m1.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m1.1">k</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p7.m1.2">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">admissible</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="\pi_{km}\neq 0" text="pi _ (k * m) not-equals 0" xml:id="S4.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The corresponding maps <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{k}\colon I_{k}\to I_{m}" text="f _ k colon I _ k to I _ m" xml:id="S4.p7.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are also called <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">admissible</text>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S4.p8">
      <p>A subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI" text="[\mcI]" xml:id="S4.p8.m1">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">domain</text> if it intersects each <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S4.p8.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> at a nonempty interval.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S4.p9">
      <p>A domain <Math mode="inline" tex="D=\bigsqcup_{k}D_{k}\subset\mcI" text="D = (square-union _ k)@(D _ k) subset-of [\mcI]" xml:id="S4.p9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="square-union" name="bigsqcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊔</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">trapping (nonstrictly trapping)</text> if
<!--  %**** String Line 375 **** -->any admissible map takes it to its interior (respectively, to itself). In other words,</p>
      <equation xml:id="S4.Ex12">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\forall k,m:\,\pi_{km}&gt;0,\,f_{k}(D_{k})\subset\inter D_{m}\quad(\,f_{k}(D_{k})%&#10;\subset D_{m}\,)." xml:id="S4.Ex12.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="for-all" name="forall" role="BIGOP">∀</XMTok>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>

    <para xml:id="S4.p11">
      <p>A finite collection of domains is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">vertically ordered</text> if they can be enumerated in such a way that for any interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S4.p11.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
