              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and for any <Math mode="inline" tex="i&lt;j" text="i less j" xml:id="S4.p11.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the intersection of <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S4.p11.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with the <Math mode="inline" tex="i" text="i" xml:id="S4.p11.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>th domain is situated below the intersection of <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S4.p11.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with the <Math mode="inline" tex="j" text="j" xml:id="S4.p11.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>th domain.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S4.p12">
      <p>An <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">admissible composition</text> is a map of the form</p>
      <equation xml:id="S4.Ex14">
        <Math mode="display" tex="f_{w_{1}\dots w_{n}}:=f_{w_{n}}\circ\dots\circ f_{w_{1}}\colon I_{w_{1}}\to I_%&#10;{w_{n+1}}," text="f _ (w _ 1 * dots * w _ n) assign f _ w _ n compose dots compose f _ w _ 1 colon I _ w _ 1 to I _ w _ (n + 1)" xml:id="S4.Ex14.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S4.Ex14.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S4.Ex14.m1.1">
                  <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>where any pair of consequent symbols <Math mode="inline" tex="(w_{i},w_{i+1})" text="open-interval@(w _ i, w _ (i + 1))" xml:id="S4.p12.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p12.m1.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p12.m1.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S4.p12.m1.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S4.p12.m1.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is admissible. An admissible composition is called a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">simple transition</text> if all the symbols <Math mode="inline" tex="w_{i}" text="w _ i" xml:id="S4.p12.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="i=1,\dots,n+1" text="i = list@(1, dots, n + 1)" xml:id="S4.p12.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p12.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p12.m3.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p12.m3.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S4.p12.m3.1">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S4.p12.m3.2">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.p12.m3.3">
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are different. An admissible composition is called a <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">simple return</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{w_{1}\dots w_{n-1}}" text="f _ (w _ 1 * dots * w _ (n - 1))" xml:id="S4.p12.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a simple transition and <Math mode="inline" tex="w_{1}=w_{n+1}" text="w _ 1 = w _ (n + 1)" xml:id="S4.p12.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S4.p13">
      <p>For an arbitrary ergodic stationary measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S4.p13.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the random process <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S4.p13.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m2.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{k}" text="mu _ k" xml:id="S4.p13.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the restriction <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu|_{I_{k}}" text="evaluated-at@(mu, I _ k)" xml:id="S4.p13.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m4.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m4.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m4.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S4.p13.m4.2">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu,k}=[A_{\mu,k},B_{\mu,k}]" text="I _ (list@(mu, k)) = closed-interval@(A _ (list@(mu, k)), B _ (list@(mu, k)))" xml:id="S4.p13.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m5.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m5.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m5.1">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m5.2">k</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m5.7"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m5.8"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.p13.m5.7">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m5.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m5.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m5.3">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m5.4">k</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S4.p13.m5.8">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                        <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m5.6"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m5.5">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

                      </XMWrap>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be the interval that spans the support of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{k}" text="mu _ k" xml:id="S4.p13.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>:</p>
      <equation xml:id="S4.Ex15">
        <Math mode="display" tex="A_{\mu,k}:=\min\supp\mu_{k},\quad B_{\mu,k}:=\max\supp\mu_{k}." text="formulae@(A _ (list@(mu, k)) assign minimum@([\supp] * mu _ k), B _ (list@(mu, k)) assign maximum@([\supp] * mu _ k))" xml:id="S4.Ex15.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S4.Ex15.m1.5"/>

                    <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>

                      <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>Note that the interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu,k}" text="I _ (list@(mu, k))" xml:id="S4.p13.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m7.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S4.p13.m7.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m7.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p13.m7.2">k</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> may not coincide with <Math mode="inline" tex="\supp\mu_{k}" text="[\supp] * mu _ k" xml:id="S4.p13.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\supp</ERROR>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S4.p14">
      <p>Finally, we state our main result on the stationary measures of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S4.p14.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p14.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p14.m1.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>:
<ERROR class="undefined">{Thm}</ERROR>
Suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S4.p14.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a generic (in the sense of Section <ref labelref="LABEL:s:typicalness"/>) step skew product. Then the following statements hold for the random process <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S4.p14.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S4.p14.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.p14.m3.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>:</p>
      <enumerate xml:id="S4.I2">
        <item labels="LABEL:t:random:1" xml:id="S4.I2.i1">
          <tags>
            <tag>(1)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S4.I2.i1.p1">
            <p>there exist only finitely many ergodic stationary measures;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:t:random:2" xml:id="S4.I2.i2">
          <tags>
            <tag>(2)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S4.I2.i2.p1">
            <p>the supports of these measures are contained in disjoint vertically ordered trapping domains;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:i:MFixed" xml:id="S4.I2.i3">
          <tags>
            <tag>(3)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 3</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1">
            <p>for any ergodic stationary measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and any <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> there exist an attracting fixed point <Math mode="inline" tex="A" text="A" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of a simple return and a simple transition <Math mode="inline" tex="f" text="f" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{\mu,k}=f(A)" text="A _ (list@(mu, k)) = f * A" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.I2.i3.p1.m5.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S4.I2.i3.p1.m5.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m5.1">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m5.2">k</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.I2.i3.p1.m5.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m5.3">A</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>; the same is true for <Math mode="inline" tex="B_{\mu,k}" text="B _ (list@(mu, k))" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.I2.i3.p1.m6.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S4.I2.i3.p1.m6.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m6.1">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S4.I2.i3.p1.m6.2">k</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.
<!--  %**** String Line 425 **** --></p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:t:random:3" xml:id="S4.I2.i4">
          <tags>
            <tag>(4)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 4</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S4.I2.i4.p1">
            <p>the (random) Lyapunov exponents of these measures are negative.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </enumerate>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S4.p15">
      <p>An upper bound on the number of ergodic stationary measures is given in Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:c:att_num"/>.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:s:typicalness" xml:id="S5">
    <tags>
      <tag>5</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">5</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§5</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">5</tag>Genericity conditions</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">5</tag>Genericity conditions</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S5.p1">
      <p>In this Section we explicitly state the genericity conditions for Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/> and Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/>:</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S5.p2">
      <enumerate xml:id="S5.I1">
        <item labels="LABEL:step_typicalnes:1" xml:id="S5.I1.i1">
          <tags>
            <tag>(1)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S5.I1.i1.p1">
            <p>Any fixed point <Math mode="inline" tex="p" text="p" xml:id="S5.I1.i1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of any simple return <Math mode="inline" tex="g" text="g" xml:id="S5.I1.i1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is hyperbolic: <Math mode="inline" tex="g^{\prime}(p)\neq 1" text="g ^ prime * p not-equals 1" xml:id="S5.I1.i1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.I1.i1.p1.m3.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.I1.i1.p1.m3.1">p</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:step_typicalnes:2" xml:id="S5.I1.i2">
          <tags>
            <tag>(2)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S5.I1.i2.p1">
            <p>No attracting fixed point of a simple return is mapped to a repelling fixed point of a simple return by a simple transition. Also, no repelling fixed point of a simple return is mapped to an attracting fixed point of a simple return by a simple transition.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item labels="LABEL:step_typicalnes:3" xml:id="S5.I1.i3">
          <tags>
            <tag>(3)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 3</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1">
            <p>One cannot choose from each interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> a single point <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{k}" text="a _ k" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> such that for any admissible couple <Math mode="inline" tex="(i,j)" text="open-interval@(i, j)" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.I1.i3.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.I1.i3.p1.m3.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m3.1">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m3.2">j</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> one would have <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{i}(a_{i})=a_{j}" text="f _ i * a _ i = a _ j" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S5.I1.i3.p1.m4.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m4.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> (in other words, so that the set <Math mode="inline" tex="\{a_{k}\}_{k=1}^{N}" text="((set@(a _ k)) _ (k = 1)) ^ N" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S5.I1.i3.p1.m5.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m5.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> would be invariant under the random dynamics <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S5.I1.i3.p1.m6.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S5.I1.i3.p1.m6.1">F</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>).</p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </enumerate>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S5.p3">
      <p>As there is only a finite number of simple transitions and simple returns, the above genericity conditions are satisfied on the complement to a finite union of codimension one subsets of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcS" text="[\mcS]" xml:id="S5.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\mcS</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.

<ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
The condition <ref labelref="LABEL:step_typicalnes:3"/> is closely related to the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">accessibility</text> property of partially hyperbolic systems (see, for instance, the handbook <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Barreira2006" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>).

<ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
<!--  %**** String Line 450 **** -->Instead of two latter conditions one may impose the following: there is no way to take a fixed point of a simple return to a fixed point of a simple return by a simple transition map, except for the case when the word defining the simple transition is a suffix of the word defining the latter simple return.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S5.p4">
      <p>In general, Theorems <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/> are false without these assumptions. For example, Ilyashenko in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ilyashenko2010b" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> gave an example of “thick” (positive measure) attractors appearing when the condition <ref labelref="LABEL:step_typicalnes:2"/> is broken.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:cor:meas_not_coincide LABEL:cor:nonintersect LABEL:l:MFixed LABEL:l:Markov-contractions LABEL:l:Markov-intervals LABEL:l:Markov-uniqueness LABEL:l:absorb LABEL:p:Markov-bony LABEL:p:SRB LABEL:p:downwards LABEL:p:word_constr LABEL:r:lim LABEL:s:proof" xml:id="S6">
    <tags>
      <tag>6</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">6</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§6</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">6</tag>Proof of the <ERROR class="undefined">\hyperref</ERROR>[t:random]stationary measures theorem</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">6</tag>Proof of the <ERROR class="undefined">\hyperref</ERROR>[t:random]stationary measures theorem</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S6.p1">
      <p>Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be an arbitrary ergodic stationary measure for the random process <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S6.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m2.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> described in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:s:random_markov"/>. For any admissible transition <Math mode="inline" tex="(i,j)" text="open-interval@(i, j)" xml:id="S6.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m3.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m3.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m3.1">i</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m3.2">j</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> we have</p>
      <equation xml:id="S6.Ex16">
        <Math mode="display" tex="f_{i}(\supp\mu_{i})\subset\supp\mu_{j}." text="f _ i * [\supp] * mu _ i subset-of [\supp] * mu _ j" xml:id="S6.Ex16.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex16.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex16.m1.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex16.m1.1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex16.m1.1.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\supp</ERROR>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\supp</ERROR>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>Because the maps <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{k}" text="f _ k" xml:id="S6.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are monotonous, the disjoint union of the intervals <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu,k}" text="I _ (list@(mu, k))" xml:id="S6.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m5.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m5.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m5.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m5.2">k</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is forward-invariant: for any admissible transition <Math mode="inline" tex="(i,j)" text="open-interval@(i, j)" xml:id="S6.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m6.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m6.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m6.1">i</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m6.2">j</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:e:I_k_forw_inv" xml:id="S6.E10">
        <tags>
          <tag>(10)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">10</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="f_{i}(I_{\mu,i})\subset I_{\mu,j}." text="f _ i * I _ (list@(mu, i)) subset-of I _ (list@(mu, j))" xml:id="S6.E10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.5"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.E10.m1.5">
                  <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.E10.m1.5.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E10.m1.1">μ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E10.m1.2">i</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.E10.m1.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E10.m1.3">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E10.m1.4">j</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>Thus the domain <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\mu}=\bigsqcup_{k}I_{\mu,k}" text="[\mcI] _ mu = (square-union _ k)@(I _ (list@(mu, k)))" xml:id="S6.p1.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="square-union" name="bigsqcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊔</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m7.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p1.m7.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m7.1">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p1.m7.2">k</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is nonstrictly trapping.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S6.p2">
      <p>The genericity conditions of Section <ref labelref="LABEL:s:typicalness"/> imply that no interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu,k}" text="I _ (list@(mu, k))" xml:id="S6.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m1.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m1.2">k</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be a single point. Otherwise by (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:I_k_forw_inv"/>) any interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu,k}" text="I _ (list@(mu, k))" xml:id="S6.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p2.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m2.1">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p2.m2.2">k</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a single a point. And this contradicts with the genericity condition <ref labelref="LABEL:step_typicalnes:3"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Lem}</ERROR>
<!--  %**** String Line 475 **** -->    <para xml:id="S6.p3">
      <p>There exist arbitrarily small strictly trapping neighborhoods of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\mu}" text="[\mcI] _ mu" xml:id="S6.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p4">
      <p>Before proving Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:l:absorb"/>, we need some auxiliary statements. The following Lemma is the statement <ref labelref="LABEL:i:MFixed"/> of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Lem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S6.p5">
      <p>For any <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S6.p5.m1">

    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p6">
        <p>By the Kakutani random ergodic theorem <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Kakutani1951" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> (see also <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Furman2002" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>) a generic sequence of random iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="(k_{n},x_{n})" text="open-interval@(k _ n, x _ n)" xml:id="S6.p6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p6.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p6.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p6.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p6.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{n}\in I_{k_{n}}" text="x _ n element-of I _ k _ n" xml:id="S6.p6.m2">

      <para xml:id="S6.p7">

            </XMath>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="(k,B_{\mu,k})" text="open-interval@(k, B _ (list@(mu, k)))" xml:id="S6.p7.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p7.m5.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p7.m5.4"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p7.m5.3">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p7.m5.4">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.p7.m5.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.p7.m5.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p7.m5.1">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p7.m5.2">k</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are accumulation points of <Math mode="inline" tex="X_{k}" text="X _ k" xml:id="S6.p7.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p8">
        <p>Now we modify the sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(k_{n},x_{n})" text="open-interval@(k _ n, x _ n)" xml:id="S6.p8.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p8.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p8.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p8.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p8.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> so that it becomes monotonous in the following sense:</p>
      </para>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{Def}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S6.p9">
        <p>An admissible sequence of iterations is called <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">downwards monotonous</text> if for any <Math mode="inline" tex="(k_{m},x_{m})" text="open-interval@(k _ m, x _ m)" xml:id="S6.p9.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="(k_{n},x_{n})" text="open-interval@(k _ n, x _ n)" xml:id="S6.p9.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p9.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m2.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p9.m2.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="k_{m}=k_{n}" text="k _ m = k _ n" xml:id="S6.p9.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="m&lt;n" text="m less n" xml:id="S6.p9.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> we have <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{m}&gt;x_{n}" text="x _ m &gt; x _ n" xml:id="S6.p9.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. In the same way we define <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">upwards monotonicity</text>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p10">
        <p>The following proposition selects a monotonous subsequence from any finite sequence of iterations.</p>
      </para>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{Prop}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S6.p11">
        <p>For any finite admissible sequence of iterations

        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex17">

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex17.m1.3.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>there exists downwards monotonous finite admissible sequence</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex18">
          <Math mode="display" tex="(w_{0},x_{0})=(w^{\prime}_{0},x^{\prime}_{0}),\dots,(w^{\prime}_{n^{\prime}},x%&#10;^{\prime}_{n^{\prime}})," text="open-interval@(w _ 0, x _ 0) = list@(open-interval@((w ^ prime) _ 0, (x ^ prime) _ 0), dots, open-interval@((w ^ prime) _ (n ^ prime), (x ^ prime) _ (n ^ prime)))" xml:id="S6.Ex18.m1">

                            </XMApp>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>

                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>such that <Math mode="inline" tex="w^{\prime}_{n^{\prime}}=w_{n}" text="(w ^ prime) _ (n ^ prime) = w _ n" xml:id="S6.p11.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime}_{n^{\prime}}\leq x_{n}" text="(x ^ prime) _ (n ^ prime) less= x _ n" xml:id="S6.p11.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S6.p12">
          <p>To find such a sequence, let us write out the symbols of the original sequence, and remove each simple return such that the point in fiber after that return is higher than before.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S6.p13">
          <p>More formally, the proof is by induction on <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S6.p13.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Assume that the existence of the desired word <Math mode="inline" tex="M(w)" text="M * w" xml:id="S6.p13.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p13.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p13.m2.1">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is proven for any initial word <Math mode="inline" tex="w" text="w" xml:id="S6.p13.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of length <Math mode="inline" tex="|w|\leq n" text="absolute-value@(w) less= n" xml:id="S6.p13.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p13.m4.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p13.m4.1">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
Let us now prove it for the word <Math mode="inline" tex="w_{0}\ldots w_{n}" text="w _ 0 * ldots * w _ n" xml:id="S6.p13.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of length <Math mode="inline" tex="n+1" text="n + 1" xml:id="S6.p13.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S6.p14">
          <p>Denote <Math mode="inline" tex="w=w_{0}\dots w_{n-1}" text="w = w _ 0 * dots * w _ (n - 1)" xml:id="S6.p14.m1">

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>: let

              </XMath>

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>

              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>). If the second of these images lies below the first one, the conclusion of the lemma is satisfied for the word <Math mode="inline" tex="w^{\prime}:=M(w)w_{n}" text="w ^ prime assign M * w * w _ n" xml:id="S6.p14.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p14.m13.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p14.m13.1">w</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Otherwise one can take <Math mode="inline" tex="w^{\prime}:=uw_{n}" text="w ^ prime assign u * w _ n" xml:id="S6.p14.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>

        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
        <para xml:id="S6.p16">
          <p>First, take a subsequence of iterations of <Math mode="inline" tex="(k_{0},x_{0})" text="open-interval@(k _ 0, x _ 0)" xml:id="S6.p16.m1">
              <XMath>
