                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.E12.m1.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E12.m1.2">D</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p31">
        <p>Consider then for any such <Math mode="inline" tex="\eps" text="[\eps]" xml:id="S6.p31.m1">
            <XMath>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\eps</ERROR>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta" text="delta" xml:id="S6.p31.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the domain <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}_{\delta}:=\bigcup_{j=0}^{N}\Phi_{\delta}^{j}(D)" text="(tilde@(D)) _ delta assign ((union _ (j = 0)) ^ N)@((Phi _ delta) ^ j * D)" xml:id="S6.p31.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="union" name="bigcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋃</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p31.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p31.m3.1">D</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Immediately from definition we see that for any domain <Math mode="inline" tex="Y" text="Y" xml:id="S6.p31.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">Y</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> one has <Math mode="inline" tex="\Phi(Y)\subset\inter\Phi_{\delta}(Y)" text="Phi * Y subset-of [\inter] * Phi _ delta * Y" xml:id="S6.p31.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p31.m5.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p31.m5.1">Y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\inter</ERROR>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p31.m5.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p31.m5.2">Y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, in particular,</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex24">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\Phi(\Phi_{\delta}^{j}(D))\subset\inter\Phi_{\delta}^{j+1}(D),\quad j=0,\dots N." text="formulae@(Phi * (Phi _ delta) ^ j * D subset-of [\inter] * (Phi _ delta) ^ (j + 1) * D, j = list@(0, dots * N))" xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.Ex24.m1.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1.4">
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex24.m1.4.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.Ex24.m1.4.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1.4.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex24.m1.4.1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1.4.1.1">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                    <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMRef idref="S6.Ex24.m1.1"/>
                                  <XMWrap>
                                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1.1">D</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                  </XMWrap>
                                </XMDual>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\inter</ERROR>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex24.m1.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1.2">D</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT" rpadding="10.0pt">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1.4.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex24.m1.3"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex24.m1.4.2.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1.3">0</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex24.m1.4.2.1">
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Hence,</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex25">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\Phi(\tilde{D}_{\delta})\subset\inter\tilde{D}_{\delta}," text="Phi * (tilde@(D)) _ delta subset-of [\inter] * (tilde@(D)) _ delta" xml:id="S6.Ex25.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.Ex25.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex25.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 600 **** -->                      <XMTok name="Phi" role="UNKNOWN">Φ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.Ex25.m1.1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex25.m1.1.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\inter</ERROR>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>and <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}_{\delta}" text="(tilde@(D)) _ delta" xml:id="S6.p31.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a trapping domain.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S6.p32">
      <p>Any ergodic stationary measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p32.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is supported inside some non-strictly trapping domain that is a union of intervals <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\mu}=\bigsqcup_{k}I_{\mu,k}" text="[\mcI] _ mu = (square-union _ k)@(I _ (list@(mu, k)))" xml:id="S6.p32.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="square-union" name="bigsqcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⊔</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p32.m2.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p32.m2.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p32.m2.1">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p32.m2.2">k</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The ends of these intervals are images of fixed points of simple returns under simple transitions. So there are only finitely many possibilities for such trapping domains.
Now the conclusions <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random:1"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random:2"/> of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/> are reduced to the following two lemmas.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Lem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S6.p33">
      <p>For any two ergodic stationary measures <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{1}" text="mu _ 1" xml:id="S6.p33.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{2}" text="mu _ 2" xml:id="S6.p33.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the corresponding intervals <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu_{1},k}" text="I _ (list@(mu _ 1, k))" xml:id="S6.p33.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p33.m3.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p33.m3.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p33.m3.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p33.m3.1">k</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu_{2},k}" text="I _ (list@(mu _ 2, k))" xml:id="S6.p33.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p33.m4.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p33.m4.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p33.m4.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p33.m4.1">k</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are either disjoint for any <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S6.p33.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or coincide for any <Math mode="inline" tex="k" text="k" xml:id="S6.p33.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In the former case they are situated in the same order on all the intervals <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S6.p33.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Lem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S6.p34">
      <p>Any stationary ergodic measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p34.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the unique stationary measure in the corresponding trapping domain <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\mu}" text="[\mcI] _ mu" xml:id="S6.p34.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p35">
      <p>To prove them, we need the following (useful for many reasons) lemma and its corollaries.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Lem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S6.p36">

                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p37.m5.3"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p37.m5.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p37.m5.3">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p37.m5.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime2" role="SUPOP">′′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Because <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{\mu,k^{\prime\prime}}=\inf\supp\mu_{k^{\prime\prime}}" text="A _ (list@(mu, k ^ prime2)) = infimum@([\supp] * mu _ (k ^ prime2))" xml:id="S6.p37.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p37.m6.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p37.m6.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p37.m6.1">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p37.m6.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime2" role="SUPOP">′′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="infimum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">inf</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\supp</ERROR>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime2" role="SUPOP">′′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu([A_{\mu,k^{\prime\prime}},p])&gt;0" text="mu * closed-interval@(A _ (list@(mu, k ^ prime2)), p) &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.p37.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p37.m7.4"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMDual xml:id="S6.p37.m7.4">
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p37.m7.4.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p37.m7.3"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.p37.m7.4.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                              </XMApp>
                              <XMWrap>

                                <XMApp xml:id="S6.p37.m7.2">

                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>

                      </XMDual>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus the generic start point <Math mode="inline" tex="(x_{0},k^{\prime\prime})" text="open-interval@(x _ 0, k ^ prime2)" xml:id="S6.p37.m8">

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> from the proof of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:l:MFixed"/> can be chosen from <Math mode="inline" tex="[A_{\mu,k^{\prime\prime}},p]" text="closed-interval@(A _ (list@(mu, k ^ prime2)), p)" xml:id="S6.p37.m9">

      <para xml:id="S6.p38">
        <p>Because <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p38.m1">
            <XMath>

              <XMApp>

                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> almost surely. So for any <Math mode="inline" tex="\eps&gt;0" text="[\eps] &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.p38.m4">

                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>

      <para xml:id="S6.p39">
        <p>The monotonicity of fiberwise maps <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{m}" text="f _ m" xml:id="S6.p39.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> implies that the image <Math mode="inline" tex="(G_{2}\circ G_{1})(I_{\mu,k})" text="(G _ 2 compose G _ 1) * I _ (list@(mu, k))" xml:id="S6.p39.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p39.m2.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p39.m2.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p39.m2.4"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p39.m2.4">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p39.m2.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.p39.m2.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p39.m2.1">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p39.m2.2">k</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is situated on the interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k^{\prime}}" text="I _ (k ^ prime)" xml:id="S6.p39.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> strictly above the point <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{2}(x_{0},k^{\prime\prime})" text="G _ 2 * open-interval@(x _ 0, k ^ prime2)" xml:id="S6.p39.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p39.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p39.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p39.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p39.m4.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime2" role="SUPOP">′′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The map <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{B}:=G_{2}\circ G_{1}" text="G _ B assign G _ 2 compose G _ 1" xml:id="S6.p39.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">B</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is constructed. The procedure for the lower endpoint <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{\mu,k^{\prime}}" text="A _ (list@(mu, k ^ prime))" xml:id="S6.p39.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p39.m6.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p39.m6.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p39.m6.1">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p39.m6.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is analogous.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Cor}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S6.p40">
      <p>For any interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S6.p40.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> there exist an interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{m}" text="I _ m" xml:id="S6.p40.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and admissible compositions <Math mode="inline" tex="G_{1,2}\colon I_{m}\to I_{k}" text="G _ (list@(1, 2)) colon I _ m to I _ k" xml:id="S6.p40.m3">

        </Math> do not intersect.</p>
    </para>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p41">
        <p>Indeed, it suffices to take the compositions that send the interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S6.p41.m1">

    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-intervals"/>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p43">
        <p>Assume the converse: let the intervals <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu_{1},k}" text="I _ (list@(mu _ 1, k))" xml:id="S6.p43.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>

                    <XMRef idref="S6.p43.m1.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p43.m1.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p43.m1.1">k</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu_{2},k}" text="I _ (list@(mu _ 2, k))" xml:id="S6.p43.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p43.m2.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p43.m2.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p43.m2.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p43.m2.1">k</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> intersect but not coincide. Then there is an endpoint of one of them that does not belong to another; without loss of generality let it be the point <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{\mu_{1},k}" text="A _ (list@(mu _ 1, k))" xml:id="S6.p43.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>

                    <XMRef idref="S6.p43.m3.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p43.m3.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p43.m3.1">k</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Take a neighborhood <Math mode="inline" tex="U\ni A_{\mu_{1},k}" text="U contains A _ (list@(mu _ 1, k))" xml:id="S6.p43.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="contains" name="ni" role="RELOP">∋</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p43.m4.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p43.m4.1">k</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu_{2},k}\cap U=\emptyset" text="I _ (list@(mu _ 2, k)) intersection U = empty-set" xml:id="S6.p43.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="empty-set" name="emptyset" role="ID">∅</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
<!--  %**** String Line 650 **** -->      <para xml:id="S6.p44">

            </XMath>
          </Math>. On the other hand, any interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu,k}" text="I _ (list@(mu, k))" xml:id="S6.p44.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is absorbing under any admissible return, so <Math mode="inline" tex="G(I_{\mu_{2},k})\subset I_{\mu_{2},k}" text="G * I _ (list@(mu _ 2, k)) subset-of I _ (list@(mu _ 2, k))" xml:id="S6.p44.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>

                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p44.m5.5">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                      <XMRef idref="S6.p44.m5.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.p44.m5.4">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p44.m5.3">k</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Then the nonempty set <Math mode="inline" tex="G(I_{\mu_{1},k}\cap I_{\mu_{2},k})" text="G * (I _ (list@(mu _ 1, k)) intersection I _ (list@(mu _ 2, k)))" xml:id="S6.p44.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p44.m6.5"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p44.m6.5">
                      <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p44.m6.2"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p44.m6.1"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.p44.m6.2">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p44.m6.1">k</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p44.m6.4"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.p44.m6.3"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S6.p44.m6.4">
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p44.m6.3">k</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is contained in both <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="S6.p44.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\mu_{2},k}" text="I _ (list@(mu _ 2, k))" xml:id="S6.p44.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p44.m8.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p44.m8.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p44.m8.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p44.m8.1">k</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This contradiction proves the first part of the lemma.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p45">
        <p>The second part of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-contractions"/> follows directly from the monotonicity of the fiberwise maps.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S6.p46">
      <p>To go on with the proof of Lemmas <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-intervals"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-uniqueness"/>, we temporary <text font="bold">switch to skew product mode:</text></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p47">
      <p>As the diffeomorphisms <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\omega}" text="f _ omega" xml:id="S6.p47.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> take the interval <Math mode="inline" tex="I" text="I" xml:id="S6.p47.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to its interior, the inverse maps <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\omega}^{-1}" text="(f _ omega) ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S6.p47.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are not everywhere defined. To overcome this technical obstacle, we extend the interval fibers <Math mode="inline" tex="I" text="I" xml:id="S6.p47.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> to circle fibers <Math mode="inline" tex="S^{1}\supset I" text="S ^ 1 superset-of I" xml:id="S6.p47.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="superset-of" name="supset" role="RELOP">⊃</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the following way:</p>
      <itemize xml:id="S6.I1">
        <item xml:id="S6.I1.i1">
          <tags>
            <tag>•</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">1st item</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S6.I1.i1.p1">
            <p>each map <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\om}" text="f _ [\om]" xml:id="S6.I1.i1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is an orientation-preserving diffeomorphism of the circle;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item xml:id="S6.I1.i2">
          <tags>
            <tag>•</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">2nd item</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S6.I1.i2.p1">
            <p>on the set <Math mode="inline" tex="S^{1}\setminus I" text="S ^ 1 set-minus I" xml:id="S6.I1.i2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> each map <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\om}" text="f _ [\om]" xml:id="S6.I1.i2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is strictly stretching: <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{\om}^{\prime}&gt;1" text="(f _ [\om]) ^ prime &gt; 1" xml:id="S6.I1.i2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item xml:id="S6.I1.i3">
          <tags>
            <tag>•</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">3rd item</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S6.I1.i3.p1">
            <p>the whole skew product is generic in the sense of Section <ref labelref="LABEL:s:typicalness"/>.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </itemize>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p48">
      <p>Then for the inverse skew product there exists a single attractor <Math mode="inline" tex="J" text="J" xml:id="S6.p48.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the strip <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma\times(S^{1}\setminus I)" text="Sigma * (S ^ 1 set-minus I)" xml:id="S6.p48.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p48.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p48.m2.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Moreover, it is a (non-bony) graph of a continuous function <Math mode="inline" tex="j\colon\Sigma\to S^{1}" text="j colon Sigma to S ^ 1" xml:id="S6.p48.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. This statement is straightforward. The detailed proof is given, for instance, in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Ilyashenko2010" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Props. 2, 3]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p49">
      <p>For any <Math mode="inline" tex="n\in\bbZ" text="n element-of [\bbZ]" xml:id="S6.p49.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\bbZ</ERROR>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{n,\om}(x)" text="f _ (list@(n, [\om])) * x" xml:id="S6.p49.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p49.m2.1">n</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S6.p49.m2.2">\om</ERROR>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p49.m2.3"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p49.m2.3">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S6.p49.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>th iterate of a fiber point <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S6.p49.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with a sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S6.p49.m5">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the base, so</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:e:n_image" xml:id="S6.E13">
        <tags>
          <tag>(13)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">13</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="F^{n}(\om,x)=(\sigma^{n}\om,f_{n,\om}(x))." text="F ^ n * open-interval@([\om], x) = open-interval@(sigma ^ n * [\om], f _ (list@(n, [\om])) * x)" xml:id="S6.E13.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.E13.m1.6"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.E13.m1.6">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.E13.m1.6.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.E13.m1.6.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.E13.m1.6.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S6.E13.m1.6.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.E13.m1.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.E13.m1.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E13.m1.1">n</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S6.E13.m1.2">\om</ERROR>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.E13.m1.5"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.E13.m1.5">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>Then for any <Math mode="inline" tex="n&gt;0" text="n &gt; 0" xml:id="S6.p49.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
      <equation xml:id="S6.Ex27">
        <Math mode="display" tex="f_{n,\om}=f_{\sigma^{n-1}\om}\circ f_{\sigma^{n-2}\om}\circ\ldots\circ f_{\om}%&#10;,\;\text{ and }\;f_{-n,\om}=f_{\sigma^{-n}\om}^{-1}\circ f_{\sigma^{-n+1}\om}^%&#10;{-1}\circ\ldots\circ f_{\sigma^{-1}\om}^{-1}=f^{-1}_{n,\sigma^{-n}\om}." text="formulae@(f _ (list@(n, [\om])) = f _ (sigma ^ (n - 1) * [\om]) compose f _ (sigma ^ (n - 2) * [\om]) compose ldots compose f _ [\om], [ and ] * f _ (list@(- n, [\om])) = (f _ (sigma ^ (- n) * [\om])) ^ (- 1) compose (f _ (sigma ^ ((- n) + 1) * [\om])) ^ (- 1) compose ldots compose (f _ (sigma ^ (- 1) * [\om])) ^ (- 1) = (f ^ (- 1)) _ (list@(n, sigma ^ (- n) * [\om])))" xml:id="S6.Ex27.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex27.m1.7"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMDual xml:id="S6.Ex27.m1.7">
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="formulae"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Ex27.m1.7.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.Ex27.m1.7.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex27.m1.7.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex27.m1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S6.Ex27.m1.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex27.m1.1">n</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S6.Ex27.m1.2">\om</ERROR>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="compose" name="circ" role="MULOP">∘</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="sigma" role="UNKNOWN">σ</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>

                          </XMApp>

    <para xml:id="S6.p50">
      <p>Suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p50.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an ergodic stationary measure of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S6.p50.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p50.m2.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. By Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:l:absorb"/>, the non-strictly trapping domain <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\mu}" text="[\mcI] _ mu" xml:id="S6.p50.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has arbitrary small strictly trapping neighborhood <Math mode="inline" tex="U(\mcI_{\mu})=\sqcup_{k}U_{k}" text="U * [\mcI] _ mu = square-union _ k U _ k" xml:id="S6.p50.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp meaning="square-union" role="ADDOP">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="square-union" name="sqcup" role="ADDOP">⊔</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}\subset\Sigma\times S^{1}" text="tilde@(D) subset-of Sigma * S ^ 1" xml:id="S6.p50.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the corresponding strip in the two-sided skew product:</p>
      <equation xml:id="S6.Ex29">
        <Math mode="display" tex="\tilde{D}:=\bigsqcup_{k}C_{k}\times U_{k}," text="tilde@(D) assign (square-union _ k)@(C _ k * U _ k)" xml:id="S6.Ex29.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S6.Ex29.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex29.m1.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                      <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="display" meaning="square-union" name="bigsqcup" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">⊔</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="C_{k}=\{\,\omega\mid\omega_{0}=k\}\subset\Sigma" text="C _ k = conditional-set@(omega, omega _ 0 = k) subset-of Sigma" xml:id="S6.p50.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="conditional-set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m6.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p50.m6.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p50.m6.1">ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="mid" role="VERTBAR">∣</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p50.m6.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. By Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:p:absorb"/>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}" text="tilde@(D)" xml:id="S6.p50.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is also strictly trapping.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Prop}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S6.p51">
      <p>The maximal attractor <Math mode="inline" tex="\Amax" text="[\Amax]" xml:id="S6.p51.m1">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\Amax</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the trapping strip <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}" text="tilde@(D)" xml:id="S6.p51.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an invariant continuous-bony graph.</p>
    </para>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p52">
        <p>Like before, we denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{\om}" text="A _ [\om]" xml:id="S6.p52.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the intersection of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Amax" text="[\Amax]" xml:id="S6.p52.m2">
            <XMath>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\Amax</ERROR>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and the fiber <Math mode="inline" tex="\{\om\}\times I" text="set@([\om]) * I" xml:id="S6.p52.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p52.m3.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S6.p52.m3.1">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. By definition,</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex30">
          <Math mode="display" tex="A_{\om}=\bigcap_{n\geq 0}A_{\om}^{(n)}," text="A _ [\om] = (intersection _ (n &gt;= 0))@((A _ [\om]) ^ n)" xml:id="S6.Ex30.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S6.Ex30.m1.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.Ex30.m1.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                        <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="display" meaning="intersection" name="bigcap" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">⋂</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.Ex30.m1.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.Ex30.m1.1">n</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where</p>
        <equation xml:id="S6.Ex31">
          <Math mode="display" tex="A_{\om}^{(n)}=f_{-1}\circ\dots\circ f_{\om_{-n}}(\tilde{D}_{\sigma^{-n}\om})." text="(A _ [\om]) ^ n = (f _ (- 1) compose dots compose f _ [\om] _ (- n)) * (tilde@(D)) _ (sigma ^ (- n) * [\om])" xml:id="S6.Ex31.m1">
            <XMath>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>

                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                          <XMApp>

                          </XMApp>

                        <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
