                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>We have to show that this sequence converges (in <Math mode="inline" tex="*" text="*" xml:id="S6.p58.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-weak topology) to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S6.p58.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. To do so, note, on one hand, that any limit point <Math mode="inline" tex="\theta=\lim_{i}\theta_{n_{i}}" text="theta = (limit _ i)@(theta _ n _ i)" xml:id="S6.p58.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="limit" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">lim</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of this sequence of measures due to the choice of the coordinate <Math mode="inline" tex="\omega" text="omega" xml:id="S6.p58.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is projected to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S6.p58.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on the base. Moreover, its support is contained in the maximal attractor <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{\max}:=\cap_{j}F^{j}(S_{\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}})" text="A _ maximum assign intersection _ j F ^ j * S _ (list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2))" xml:id="S6.p58.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="maximum" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">max</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp meaning="intersection" role="ADDOP">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m6.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m6.3">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m6.1"/>
                              <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m6.2"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m6.1">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m6.2">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. On the other hand, <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S6.p58.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-almost every fiber <Math mode="inline" tex="h^{-1}(\omega^{\prime})" text="h ^ (- 1) * omega ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p58.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m8.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m8.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> intersects the maximal attractor by a single point <Math mode="inline" tex="(\om^{\prime},\varphi(\om^{\prime}))" text="open-interval@([\om] ^ prime, varphi * [\om] ^ prime)" xml:id="S6.p58.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m9.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m9.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m9.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m9.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m9.2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m9.2.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus the conditional measure of <Math mode="inline" tex="\theta" text="theta" xml:id="S6.p58.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on almost every fiber is the Dirac measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta_{(\om^{\prime},\varphi(\om^{\prime}))}" text="delta _ (open-interval@([\om] ^ prime, varphi * [\om] ^ prime))" xml:id="S6.p58.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m11.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m11.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m11.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                      <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m11.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.p58.m11.2.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.p58.m11.2.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                            <XMTok fontsize="50%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and hence the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\theta" text="theta" xml:id="S6.p58.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> itself coincides with the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\bf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S6.p58.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p59">
        <p>The uniqueness of the limit point and compactness of the space of measures now imply that all the sequence of time averages  <Math mode="inline" tex="\theta_{n}" text="theta _ n" xml:id="S6.p59.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="theta" role="UNKNOWN">θ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> converges to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\bf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S6.p59.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S6.p60">
      <p>The same arguments imply than for any measure <text class="ltx_markedasmath" font="bold">m</text>, supported in <Math mode="inline" tex="S_{\varphi_{1},\varphi_{2}}" text="S _ (list@(varphi _ 1, varphi _ 2))" xml:id="S6.p60.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p60.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p60.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p60.m2.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p60.m2.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="50%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, that projects to the Markov measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S6.p60.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on the base, its iterations converge to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S6.p60.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Indeed, any accumulation point of the sequence of measures <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{*}^{n}\mathbf{m}" text="(F _ *) ^ n * m" xml:id="S6.p60.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a measure, supported on the maximal attractor <Math mode="inline" tex="A_{max}" text="A _ (m * a * x)" xml:id="S6.p60.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">A</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and such that it projects to the Markov measure on the base. Hence, any accumulation point of this sequence of iterations coincides with <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S6.p60.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and thus the entire sequence converges to <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S6.p60.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S6.p61">
      <p>Now to prove Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-uniqueness"/>, we <text font="bold">switch back
back to Random Walk mode:</text></p>
    </para>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof of Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-uniqueness"/>.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p62">
        <p>As we have already mentioned in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:s:random_markov"/>, in a skew product over the Markov shift in the space of one-sided sequences <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma_{+}" text="Sigma _ +" xml:id="S6.p62.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu^{\prime}" text="mu ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p62.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> corresponds measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}^{\prime}" text="(m _ +) ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p62.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, defined by formula (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:inv_measure"/>).
As one can easily see from the definition, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}^{\prime}" text="(m _ +) ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p62.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{+}" text="F _ +" xml:id="S6.p62.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p63">
        <p>Consider now the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}^{\prime}=\sum_{k}\nu_{k}\times\mu_{k}" text="m ^ prime = (sum _ k)@(nu _ k * mu _ k)" xml:id="S6.p63.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, that is given by the same sum, but for the skew product over the shift on space of two-sided sequences. In general, <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{*}\mathbf{m}^{\prime}\neq\mathbf{m}^{\prime}" text="F _ * * m ^ prime not-equals m ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p63.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. However, as the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}^{\prime}" text="(m _ +) ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p63.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{+}" text="F _ +" xml:id="S6.p63.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-invariant, all the iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{*}^{n}\mathbf{m}^{\prime}" text="(F _ *) ^ n * m ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p63.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> project to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}^{\prime}" text="(m _ +) ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p63.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on the skew product over the shift on space of one-sided sequences. Hence, projection on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI" text="[\mcI]" xml:id="S6.p63.m7">
            <XMath>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of any of these iterations gives us the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu^{\prime}" text="mu ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p63.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (which is the projection of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{+}^{\prime}" text="(m _ +) ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p63.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>).</p>
      </para>
<!--  %**** String Line 800 **** -->      <para xml:id="S6.p64">
        <p>By construction, the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}^{\prime}" text="m ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p64.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> projects to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S6.p64.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on the base. Due to Remark <ref labelref="LABEL:r:lim"/>, the iterations <Math mode="inline" tex="F_{*}^{n}\mathbf{m}^{\prime}" text="(F _ *) ^ n * m ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p64.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}^{\prime}" text="m ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p64.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> converge to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S6.p64.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. On the other hand, all these iterations project to the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p64.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI" text="[\mcI]" xml:id="S6.p64.m7">
            <XMath>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, thus the same holds for their limit. Hence, the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p64.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the projection on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI" text="[\mcI]" xml:id="S6.p64.m9">
            <XMath>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S6.p64.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. This projection is the distribution <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{*}\nu" text="varphi _ * * nu" xml:id="S6.p64.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of the values of the map <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi" text="varphi" xml:id="S6.p64.m12">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, that corresponds to the graph part of the maximal attractor. As we supposed only that the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu^{\prime}" text="mu ^ prime" xml:id="S6.p64.m13">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a stationary measure on the domain <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\mu}" text="[\mcI] _ mu" xml:id="S6.p64.m14">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the stationary measure on this domain is unique (and hence it is the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S6.p64.m15">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S6.p65">
        <p>∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:s:bax" xml:id="S7">
    <tags>
      <tag>7</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">7</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§7</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">7</tag>Smooth Stochastic Perturbations and the Baxendale’s Theorem</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">7</tag>Smooth Stochastic Perturbations and the Baxendale’s Theorem</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S7.p1">
      <p>In this Section, we complete the proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/>. The conclusions <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random:1"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random:2"/> of the theorem follow from Lemmas <ref labelref="LABEL:l:MFixed"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-intervals"/>, and <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-uniqueness"/>. To prove that the (random) Lyapunov exponent of any ergodic stationary measure is negative, we introduce stochastic skew products over discrete Markov chains and prove for them Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:baxendale"/> which is an analogue of the Baxendale’s <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Baxendale1989" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 4.2]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <subsection inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:t:baxendale" xml:id="S7.SS1">
      <tags>
        <tag>7.1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">7.1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§7.1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">7.1</tag>Stochastic Skew Products</title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">7.1</tag>Stochastic Skew Products</toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p1">
        <p>In this paper, a stochastic skew product over a Markov chain is an object of 3 components:</p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S7.I1">
          <item xml:id="S7.I1.i1">
            <tags>
              <tag>(1)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1">
              <p>a discrete transitive Markov chain with <Math mode="inline" tex="N" text="N" xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> states <Math mode="inline" tex="\{1,\dots,N\}" text="set@(1, dots, N)" xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I1.i1.p1.m2.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I1.i1.p1.m2.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I1.i1.p1.m2.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1.m2.1">1</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1.m2.2">…</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1.m2.3">N</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>, given by its transition matrix <Math mode="inline" tex="(\pi_{ij})" text="pi _ (i * j)" xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.I1.i1.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1.m3.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> and the stationary distribution <Math mode="inline" tex="p_{i}" text="p _ i" xml:id="S7.I1.i1.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">p</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> of this chain;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S7.I1.i2">
            <tags>
              <tag>(2)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I1.i2.p1">
              <p>a compact manifold <Math mode="inline" tex="M" text="M" xml:id="S7.I1.i2.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S7.I1.i3">
            <tags>
              <tag>(3)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 3</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I1.i3.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="N" text="N" xml:id="S7.I1.i3.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">N</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> random variables <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi_{ij}" text="xi _ (i * j)" xml:id="S7.I1.i3.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> taking values in <Math mode="inline" tex="\DiffIm^{1}(M)" text="[\DiffIm] ^ 1 * M" xml:id="S7.I1.i3.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <ERROR class="undefined">\DiffIm</ERROR>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I1.i3.p1.m3.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I1.i3.p1.m3.1">M</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>.</p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
        <p>Observe that if all <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi_{ij}" text="xi _ (i * j)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> are almost surely constant, then the stochastic skew product is a usual deterministic skew product.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p2">
        <p>Similarly to Section <ref labelref="LABEL:s:random_markov"/>, denote <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{M}:=\{1,\dots,N\}\times M" text="M assign set@(1, dots, N) * M" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p2.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p2.m1.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p2.m1.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m1.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m1.2">…</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m1.3">N</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{M}_{i}:=\{i\}\times M" text="M _ i assign set@(i) * M" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p2.m2.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m2.1">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. A probability measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{M}" text="M" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is called stationary if</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:e:stoch_img_2" xml:id="S7.E15">
          <tags>
            <tag>(15)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">15</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\sum_{i}\pi_{ij}\cdot\bbE(\xi_{ij})_{*}\mu_{i}=\mu_{j}," text="(sum _ i)@((pi _ (i * j) cdot [\bbE]) * xi _ (i * j) _ * * mu _ i) = mu _ j" xml:id="S7.E15.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.E15.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.E15.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\bbE</ERROR>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.E15.m1.1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S7.E15.m1.1.1">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
<!--  %**** String Line 825 **** -->                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{i}=\mu|_{\mathcal{M}_{i}}" text="mu _ i = evaluated-at@(mu, M _ i)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p2.m5.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p2.m5.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m5.1">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m5.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="50%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The expectation is taken over the <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi_{ij}" text="xi _ (i * j)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-images of the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{i}" text="mu _ i" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (not the “spacewise” expectation along <Math mode="inline" tex="M" text="M" xml:id="S7.SS1.p2.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p3">
        <p>Assume that for any <Math mode="inline" tex="i,j" text="list@(i, j)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p3.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m1.1">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m1.2">j</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> we have</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:e:lognorm" xml:id="S7.E16">
          <tags>
            <tag>(16)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">16</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\bbE\log\norm{D\xi_{ij}}&lt;+\infty." text="[\bbE] * logarithm@([\norm] * D * xi _ (i * j)) less + infinity" xml:id="S7.E16.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.E16.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.E16.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <ERROR class="undefined">\bbE</ERROR>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">log</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\norm</ERROR>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Then for any ergodic stationary probability measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S7.SS1.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> its random volume Lyapunov exponent (which is the sum of its random Lyapunov exponents) is well defined and is given by the following formula:</p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:e:lyap-vol" xml:id="S7.E17">
          <tags>
            <tag>(17)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">17</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="\lambda_{vol}=\sum_{i,j}\pi_{ij}\cdot\bbE\int_{M}\log\Jac\xi_{ij}|_{x}d\mu_{i}%&#10;(x)." text="lambda _ (v * o * l) = evaluated-at@((sum _ (list@(i, j)))@((pi _ (i * j) cdot [\bbE]) * (integral _ M)@(logarithm@([\Jac] * xi _ (i * j)))), x) * d * mu _ i * x" xml:id="S7.E17.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.E17.m1.5"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.E17.m1.5">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="evaluated-at"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.E17.m1.5.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.E17.m1.3"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMApp xml:id="S7.E17.m1.5.1">
                              <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                                <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                <XMDual>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S7.E17.m1.1"/>
                                    <XMRef idref="S7.E17.m1.2"/>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMWrap>

                                  <XMApp>

                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <ERROR class="undefined">\bbE</ERROR>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMApp>

                                    <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">log</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                      <ERROR class="undefined">\Jac</ERROR>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                                        <XMApp>
                                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                                        </XMApp>
                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.E17.m1.3">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.E17.m1.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.E17.m1.4">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
      </para>
      <ERROR class="undefined">{Thm}</ERROR>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p4">
        <p>[Baxendale’s Theorem for stochastic skew products]
Let a stochastic skew product over a Markov chain <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi" text="Pi" xml:id="S7.SS1.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> satisfy (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:lognorm"/>). Then at least one of the following options is true:</p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S7.I2">
          <item labels="LABEL:i:esm" xml:id="S7.I2.i1">
            <tags>
              <tag>(1)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I2.i1.p1">
              <p>there exists an ergodic stationary measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S7.I2.i1.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda_{vol}(\mu)&lt;0" text="lambda _ (v * o * l) * mu less 0" xml:id="S7.I2.i1.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.I2.i1.p1.m2.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I2.i1.p1.m2.1">μ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item labels="LABEL:i:asi" xml:id="S7.I2.i2">
            <tags>
              <tag>(2)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I2.i2.p1">
              <p>there exists an almost surely <Math mode="inline" tex="\xi_{ij}" text="xi _ (i * j)" xml:id="S7.I2.i2.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>-invariant measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S7.I2.i2.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{M}" text="M" xml:id="S7.I2.i2.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>:</p>
              <equation xml:id="S7.Ex38">
                <Math mode="display" tex="\forall i,j\quad(\xi_{ij})_{*}\nu_{i}=\nu_{j}\quad\text{with the probability~{%&#10;}$1$}." text="formulae@(list@(for-all@(i), j, xi _ (i * j) _ * * nu _ i) = nu _ j, [with the probability 1])" xml:id="S7.Ex38.m1">

      <proof>
        <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
<!--  %**** String Line 850 **** -->        <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p5">
          <p>To prove Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:baxendale"/>, we follow the spirit of the argument
from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="Baxendale1989" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 4.2]</cite>. For any two probabilities <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1},m_{2}" text="list@(m _ 1, m _ 2)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p5.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m1.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m1.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> on some Polish space <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> such that <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}\ll m_{2}" text="m _ 1 lessless m _ 2" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="much-less-than" name="ll" role="RELOP">≪</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, the <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">relative entropy</text> (also known as the Kullback-Leibler information divergence) of <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}" text="m _ 1" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> with respect to <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{2}" text="m _ 2" xml:id="S7.SS1.p5.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is</p>
          <equation labels="LABEL:e:rel-entropy" xml:id="S7.E18">
            <tags>
              <tag>(18)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">18</tag>
            </tags>
            <Math mode="display" tex="h(m_{1}|m_{2}):=\sup_{\psi\in C(X)}\left[\log\int e^{\psi}\,dm_{1}-\int\psi\,%&#10;dm_{2}\right]=\left\{\begin{array}[]{ll}\int\left(\log\frac{dm_{1}}{dm_{2}}%&#10;\right)\,dm_{1},&amp;\hbox{if $m_{1}\ll m_{2}$;}\\&#10;+\infty,&amp;\hbox{otherwise.}\end{array}\right." text="h * conditional@(m _ 1, m _ 2) assign (supremum _ (psi element-of C * X))@(delimited-[]@(logarithm * integral@(e ^ psi * differential-d@(m _ 1)) - integral@(psi * differential-d@(m _ 2)))) = cases@(Array[[integral@(logarithm@((d * m _ 1) / (d * m _ 2)) * differential-d@(m _ 1)), [if ≪m1m2;]], [+ infinity, [otherwise.]]])" xml:id="S7.E18.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.E18.m1.5"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.E18.m1.5">
                          <XMTok meaning="conditional" role="MODIFIEROP" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="supremum" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="mid">sup</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.E18.m1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.E18.m1.1">X</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.E18.m1.6"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">[</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.E18.m1.6">
                          <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok meaning="logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">log</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp rpadding="1.7pt">
                                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN">ψ</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" meaning="differential-d" role="DIFFOP">d</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="psi" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="1.7pt">ψ</XMTok>
                              <XMApp>
                                <XMTok font="italic" meaning="differential-d" role="DIFFOP">d</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                                </XMApp>
                              </XMApp>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="true">]</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="cases"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.E18.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">{</XMTok>
                      <XMArray role="ARRAY" vattach="middle" xml:id="S7.E18.m1.4">
                        <XMRow>
                          <XMCell align="left">
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.E18.m1.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S7.E18.m1.2">
                                  <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="integral" name="int" role="INTOP">∫</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                    <XMDual>
                                      <XMRef idref="S7.E18.m1.2.1"/>
                                      <XMWrap>
                                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="true">(</XMTok>
                                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.E18.m1.2.1">
                                          <XMTok meaning="logarithm" role="OPFUNCTION">log</XMTok>
                                          <XMApp>
                                            <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                                            <XMApp>
                                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">d</XMTok>
                                              <XMApp>
                                                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post11"/>

                                              </XMApp>
                                            </XMApp>

                                              </XMApp>
                                            </XMApp>
                                          </XMApp>
                                        </XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" rpadding="1.7pt" stretchy="true">)</XMTok>
                                      </XMWrap>
                                    </XMDual>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" meaning="differential-d" role="DIFFOP">d</XMTok>
                                      <XMApp>
                                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post9"/>
                                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>

                                      </XMApp>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMCell>
                          <XMCell align="left">
                            <XMText>if <Math mode="inline" tex="m_{1}\ll m_{2}" text="m _ 1 lessless m _ 2" xml:id="S7.E18.m1.m1">
                                <XMath>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="much-less-than" name="ll" role="RELOP">≪</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post12"/>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post12"/>

                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMath>
                              </Math>;</XMText>
                          </XMCell>
                        </XMRow>
                        <XMRow>
                          <XMCell align="left">
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.E18.m1.3"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S7.E18.m1.3">
                                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
