            </Math>
          </equation>
          <p>This is the option <ref labelref="LABEL:i:esm"/>) of the theorem.</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p15">
          <p>On the other hand, the relative entropy is upper semicontinuous as the supremum of continuous functionals. Hence, in the former case for any admissible <Math mode="inline" tex="(i,j)" text="open-interval@(i, j)" xml:id="S7.SS1.p15.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p15.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p15.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p15.m1.1">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS1.p15.m1.2">j</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> one has almost surely
<Math mode="inline" tex="h((\xi_{ij})_{*}\mu_{i}|\mu_{j})=0" text="h * conditional@(xi _ (i * j) _ * * mu _ i, mu _ j) = 0" xml:id="S7.SS1.p15.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">h</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p15.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p15.m2.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="conditional" role="MODIFIEROP" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMDual>
                                <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p15.m2.1.1"/>
                                <XMWrap>
                                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p15.m2.1.1">
                                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                                    <XMApp>
                                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                                    </XMApp>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                                </XMWrap>
                              </XMDual>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and thus <Math mode="inline" tex="(\xi_{ij})_{*}\mu_{i}=\mu_{j}" text="xi _ (i * j) _ * * mu _ i = mu _ j" xml:id="S7.SS1.p15.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.SS1.p15.m3.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.SS1.p15.m3.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="times" role="MULOP">*</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. This is the option <ref labelref="LABEL:i:asi"/>).</p>
        </para>
        <para xml:id="S7.SS1.p16">
          <p>Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:baxendale"/> is proven.
<!--  %**** String Line 925 **** -->∎</p>
        </para>
      </proof>
    </subsection>
    <subsection inlist="toc" xml:id="S7.SS2">
      <tags>
        <tag>7.2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">7.2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">§7.2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title><tag close=". ">7.2</tag>The proof of the Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/></title>
      <toctitle><tag close=" ">7.2</tag>The proof of the Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/></toctitle>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS2.p1">
        <p>Recall the Markov process <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS2.p1.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m1.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> defined in Section <ref labelref="LABEL:s:random_markov"/>. Fix any ergodic stationary measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\eta" text="eta" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS2.p1.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m3.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Restrict <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS2.p1.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m4.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to the trapping region <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\eta}" text="[\mcI] _ eta" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The process <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS2.p1.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS2.p1.m6.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> can be viewed as a stochastic skew product over a Markov chain with</p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S7.I4">
          <item xml:id="S7.I4.i1">
            <tags>
              <tag>(1)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I4.i1.p1">
              <p>the Markov chain equal to our given Markov chain in the base;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S7.I4.i2">
            <tags>
              <tag>(2)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I4.i2.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="M=\mcI_{\eta}" text="M = [\mcI] _ eta" xml:id="S7.I4.i2.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">M</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>;</p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S7.I4.i3">
            <tags>
              <tag>(3)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 3</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S7.I4.i3.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\xi_{ij}" text="xi _ (i * j)" xml:id="S7.I4.i3.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math> equal to the <Math mode="inline" tex="\delta" text="delta" xml:id="S7.I4.i3.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="delta" role="UNKNOWN">δ</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>-measures at <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{i}\in\DiffIm^{1}(M)" text="f _ i element-of [\DiffIm] ^ 1 * M" xml:id="S7.I4.i3.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\DiffIm</ERROR>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.I4.i3.p1.m3.1"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I4.i3.p1.m3.1">M</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>.</p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS2.p2">
        <p>Apply the Baxendale’s Theorem to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S7.SS2.p2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.SS2.p2.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.SS2.p2.m1.1">F</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The option <ref labelref="LABEL:i:asi"/> is impossible by Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:cor:meas_not_coincide"/>.
Thus the option <ref labelref="LABEL:i:esm"/> is true, and there exists an ergodic stationary measure in <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\eta}" text="[\mcI] _ eta" xml:id="S7.SS2.p2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda_{vol}&lt;0" text="lambda _ (v * o * l) less 0" xml:id="S7.SS2.p2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. As <Math mode="inline" tex="\dim I=1" text="dimension@(I) = 1" xml:id="S7.SS2.p2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="dimension" role="LIMITOP">dim</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\lambda_{vol}" text="lambda _ (v * o * l)" xml:id="S7.SS2.p2.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">o</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">l</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is just its random Lyapunov exponent.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.SS2.p3">
        <p>But by Lemma <ref labelref="LABEL:l:Markov-uniqueness"/>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\eta" text="eta" xml:id="S7.SS2.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the unique stationary measure in <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI_{\eta}" text="[\mcI] _ eta" xml:id="S7.SS2.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Hence <Math mode="inline" tex="\Lyap\eta&lt;0" text="[\Lyap] * eta less 0" xml:id="S7.SS2.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\Lyap</ERROR>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The proof of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/> is complete.</p>
      </para>
    </subsection>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:c:att_num LABEL:p:att_num LABEL:p:limit_step LABEL:p:meas_on_limit LABEL:r:att_num LABEL:r:lyap LABEL:s:proof_markov_classif" xml:id="S8">
    <tags>
      <tag>8</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">8</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§8</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">8</tag>Proof of the skew products theorem</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">8</tag>Proof of the skew products theorem</toctitle>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Prop}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S8.p1">
      <p>Let the map <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi(\omega)" text="varphi * omega" xml:id="S8.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p1.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p1.m1.1">ω</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi\colon\Sigma\to S^{1}" text="varphi colon Sigma to S ^ 1" xml:id="S8.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, depend only on finitely many symbols in <Math mode="inline" tex="\omega" text="omega" xml:id="S8.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Suppose its graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S8.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> drifts up (down). Then</p>
      <enumerate xml:id="S8.I1">
        <item xml:id="S8.I1.i1">
          <tags>
            <tag>(1)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 1</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S8.I1.i1.p1">
            <p>the pointwise limit of its iterates <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma_{n}=F^{n}(\Gamma)" text="Gamma _ n = F ^ n * Gamma" xml:id="S8.I1.i1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S8.I1.i1.p1.m1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.I1.i1.p1.m1.1">Γ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> as <Math mode="inline" tex="n\to+\infty" text="n to + infinity" xml:id="S8.I1.i1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is the graph of a measurable function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{+\infty}\colon\Sigma\to S^{1}" text="varphi _ (+ infinity) colon Sigma to S ^ 1" xml:id="S8.I1.i1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>;</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item xml:id="S8.I1.i2">
          <tags>
            <tag>(2)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 2</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S8.I1.i2.p1">
            <p>the function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{+\infty}(\om)" text="varphi _ (+ infinity) * [\om]" xml:id="S8.I1.i2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.I1.i2.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S8.I1.i2.p1.m1.1">\om</ERROR>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> does not depend on “future” of <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S8.I1.i2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                </XMath>
              </Math>:
<!--  %**** String Line 950 **** --></p>
            <equation xml:id="S8.Ex42">

        <item xml:id="S8.I1.i3">

          <para xml:id="S8.I1.i3.p1">
            <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{+\infty}" text="varphi _ (+ infinity)" xml:id="S8.I1.i3.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is invariant under <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S8.I1.i3.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>:</p>
            <equation xml:id="S8.Ex43">
              <Math mode="display" tex="\varphi_{+\infty}(\sigma\om)=f_{\om}(\varphi_{+\infty}(\om))." text="varphi _ (+ infinity) * sigma * [\om] = f _ [\om] * varphi _ (+ infinity) * [\om]" xml:id="S8.Ex43.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.Ex43.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex43.m1.2">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>

                            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S8.Ex43.m1.2.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex43.m1.2.2">
                                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S8.p2">
      <p>The analogous statement holds for <Math mode="inline" tex="n\to-\infty" text="n to - infinity" xml:id="S8.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The limit function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{-\infty}" text="varphi _ (- infinity)" xml:id="S8.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> does not depend on the “past” of <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S8.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S8.p3">
        <p>Take any <Math mode="inline" tex="\om\in\Sigma" text="[\om] element-of Sigma" xml:id="S8.p3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{n}" text="varphi _ n" xml:id="S8.p3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> be the function that corresponds to the graph <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma_{n}" text="Gamma _ n" xml:id="S8.p3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Because <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma" text="Gamma" xml:id="S8.p3.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> drifts up (down), the sequence <Math mode="inline" tex="(\varphi_{n}(\om))" text="varphi _ n * [\om]" xml:id="S8.p3.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m5.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p3.m5.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m5.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S8.p3.m5.1">\om</ERROR>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is monotone. It is also bounded because of the invariant repeller graph <Math mode="inline" tex="J\subset\Sigma\times(S^{1}\setminus I)" text="J subset-of Sigma * (S ^ 1 set-minus I)" xml:id="S8.p3.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p3.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.p3.m6.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{+\infty}" text="varphi _ (+ infinity)" xml:id="S8.p3.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is well defined. Because <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{+\infty}" text="varphi _ (+ infinity)" xml:id="S8.p3.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a pointwise limit of continuous functions <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{n}" text="varphi _ n" xml:id="S8.p3.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, it must be measurable.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S8.p4">
        <p>Now let <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi(\om)" text="varphi * [\om]" xml:id="S8.p4.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p4.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined" xml:id="S8.p4.m1.1">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> depend only on <Math mode="inline" tex="\om_{-k},\ldots,\om_{m}" text="list@([\om] _ (- k), ldots, [\om] _ m)" xml:id="S8.p4.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p4.m2.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p4.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p4.m2.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p4.m2.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="ldots" role="ID" xml:id="S8.p4.m2.1">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p4.m2.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S8.p4.m3">
            <XMath>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. The function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{n}" text="varphi _ n" xml:id="S8.p4.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has the form</p>
        <equation xml:id="S8.Ex44">
          <Math mode="display" tex="\varphi_{n}(\om)=f_{n,\sigma^{-n}\om}(\varphi(\sigma^{-n}\om))." text="varphi _ n * [\om] = f _ (list@(n, sigma ^ (- n) * [\om])) * varphi * sigma ^ (- n) * [\om]" xml:id="S8.Ex44.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.Ex44.m1.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.Ex44.m1.4">

        </equation>
        <p>Then for every <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq m+1" text="n &gt;= m + 1" xml:id="S8.p4.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{n}" text="varphi _ n" xml:id="S8.p4.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> depends only on <Math mode="inline" tex="\om_{-k-n},\ldots,\om_{-1}" text="list@([\om] _ (- k - n), ldots, [\om] _ (- 1))" xml:id="S8.p4.m7">

                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p4.m7.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. In particular, <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{n}" text="varphi _ n" xml:id="S8.p4.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> does not depend on <Math mode="inline" tex="\om_{[0,+\infty]}" text="[\om] _ (closed-interval@(0, + infinity))" xml:id="S8.p4.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p4.m9.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p4.m9.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S8.p4.m9.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.p4.m9.2">
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>. Thus the limit function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{+\infty}=\lim_{n\to+\infty}\varphi_{n}" text="varphi _ (+ infinity) = (limit _ (n to + infinity))@(varphi _ n)" xml:id="S8.p4.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="limit" role="LIMITOP" scriptpos="post">lim</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is also independent of <Math mode="inline" tex="\om_{[0,+\infty]}" text="[\om] _ (closed-interval@(0, + infinity))" xml:id="S8.p4.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p4.m11.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p4.m11.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S8.p4.m11.1">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.p4.m11.2">
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S8.p5">
        <p>The invariance of <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi_{+\infty}" text="varphi _ (+ infinity)" xml:id="S8.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> immediately follows from the definition of limit.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>

    <para xml:id="S8.p7">
      <p>Suppose a function <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi\colon\Sigma\to S^{1}" text="varphi colon Sigma to S ^ 1" xml:id="S8.p7.m1">

              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> such that
