    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S8.p8">
        <p>Because <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi" text="varphi" xml:id="S8.p8.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is independent of the future, the projection of the measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S8.p8.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> to <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma_{+}\times S^{1}" text="Sigma _ + * S ^ 1" xml:id="S8.p8.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> has the following simple form. The restriction of the projection to each cylinder <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathcal{C}_{k}" text="C _ k" xml:id="S8.p8.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> it is the Cartesian product of <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu_{k}^{+}" text="(nu _ k) ^ +" xml:id="S8.p8.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and some measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{k}" text="mu _ k" xml:id="S8.p8.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{k}" text="I _ k" xml:id="S8.p8.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, see (<ref labelref="LABEL:e:inv_measure"/>). These measures <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{k}" text="mu _ k" xml:id="S8.p8.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">k</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> constitute the desired stationary measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S8.p8.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> on <Math mode="inline" tex="\mcI" text="[\mcI]" xml:id="S8.p8.m10">
            <XMath>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\mcI</ERROR>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S8.p9">
      <p>By definition, the fiberwise Lyapunov exponent of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{\varphi}" text="m _ varphi" xml:id="S8.p9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> equals to the random Lyapunov exponent of <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S8.p9.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S8.p10">
      <p>The analogous statements holds for any <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi" text="varphi" xml:id="S8.p10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> that is independent of the past. Measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S8.p10.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is stationary for the process <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F^{-1})" text="Pi * F ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S8.p10.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p10.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p10.m3.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S8.p11">
      <p>Now we are ready to prove Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/>.
By Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:random"/>, the process <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F)" text="Pi * F" xml:id="S8.p11.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p11.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p11.m1.1">F</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has finitely many ergodic stationary measures. Their supports are contained in disjoint vertically sorted trapping regions. These regions correspond to the trapping strips in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma\times S^{1}" text="Sigma * S ^ 1" xml:id="S8.p11.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. By Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:p:Markov-bony"/>, the maximal attractors of these strips are CBGs. Thus any strip has a unique invariant measure projecting to <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S8.p11.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the base. By Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:p:SRB"/>, this measure is physical. The claims <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:1"/>, <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:2"/> are established. Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:p:thin_conj"/> implies claim <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:2.5"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S8.p12">
      <p>Because the fiber maps are monotonous, the complement to the disjoint union of the trapping strips is also the disjoint union of finitely many vertically ordered step strips. The <Math mode="inline" tex="F" text="F" xml:id="S8.p12.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-images of these strips are step w.r.t. the symbol <Math mode="inline" tex="\omega_{-1}" text="omega _ (- 1)" xml:id="S8.p12.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="omega" role="UNKNOWN">ω</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S8.p12.m3">
          <XMath>
            <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. These new strips are inverse trapping.
<!--  %**** String Line 1000 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S8.p13">
      <p>Let us see what happens in any of these strips. According to Propositions <ref labelref="LABEL:p:limit_step"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:p:meas_on_limit"/>, the limits of the backward iterates of its lower and upper boundaries are some invariant measurable graphs <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma_{L}" text="Gamma _ L" xml:id="S8.p13.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Gamma_{U}" text="Gamma _ U" xml:id="S8.p13.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok name="Gamma" role="UNKNOWN">Γ</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. They support invariant measures, namely, the lifts of <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S8.p13.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. These invariant measures in turn correspond to some stationary measures <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{L}" text="m _ L" xml:id="S8.p13.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{U}" text="m _ U" xml:id="S8.p13.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="\Pi(F^{-1})" text="Pi * F ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S8.p13.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Pi" role="UNKNOWN">Π</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p13.m6.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p13.m6.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">F</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Suppose <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{L}" text="m _ L" xml:id="S8.p13.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{U}" text="m _ U" xml:id="S8.p13.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> do not coincide. Then there is an invariant attracting graph between them which has its own trapping strip. Thus the inverse trapping strip can decomposed into at least two strips. This contradiction proves that <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{L}=\mathbf{m}_{U}" text="m _ L = m _ U" xml:id="S8.p13.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. The unique stationary measure <Math mode="inline" tex="\mathbf{m}_{L}=\mathbf{m}_{U}" text="m _ L = m _ U" xml:id="S8.p13.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="bold" role="UNKNOWN">m</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> corresponds to the unique repeller within the inverse trapping strip. The claim <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:4"/> is proven.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S8.p14">
      <p>The claim <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:3"/> follows from Rem. <ref labelref="LABEL:r:lyap"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S8.p15">
      <p>Finally, the drifting up (down) border of any trapping strip converges a.e. to the corresponding attractor as <Math mode="inline" tex="n\to+\infty" text="n to + infinity" xml:id="S8.p15.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and to the corresponding repeller as <Math mode="inline" tex="n\to-\infty" text="n to - infinity" xml:id="S8.p15.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. This makes a.e. point between the attractor and the repeller do the same. Thus the basins of attractors and repellers cover the whole phase space <Math mode="inline" tex="\Sigma\times S^{1}" text="Sigma * S ^ 1" xml:id="S8.p15.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with the exception of zero measure set in the base. The claim <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification:0.5"/> is proven. Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:t:markov_classification"/> is complete.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S8.p16">
      <p>We conclude this paper with an estimate of the number of attractors and repellers.
For any <Math mode="inline" tex="f" text="f" xml:id="S8.p16.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="\AFix(f)" text="[\AFix] * f" xml:id="S8.p16.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\AFix</ERROR>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p16.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p16.m2.1">f</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the set of all attracting fixed points of <Math mode="inline" tex="f" text="f" xml:id="S8.p16.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.
<ERROR class="undefined">{Prop}</ERROR> 
Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\om\in\Sigma" text="[\om] element-of Sigma" xml:id="S8.p16.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              <XMTok name="Sigma" role="UNKNOWN">Σ</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be any periodic sequence, <Math mode="inline" tex="\om=(w)=\dots www\dots" text="[\om] = w = dots * w * w * w * dots" xml:id="S8.p16.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p16.m5.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p16.m5.1">w</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                <XMTok name="dots" role="ID">…</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Let <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}" text="tilde@(D)" xml:id="S8.p16.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> be any trapping strip. Then there exist <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{1},a_{2}\in\AFix(f_{w})" text="list@(a _ 1, a _ 2) element-of [\AFix] * f _ w" xml:id="S8.p16.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p16.m7.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p16.m7.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p16.m7.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p16.m7.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\AFix</ERROR>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p16.m7.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S8.p16.m7.3">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> (perhaps, <Math mode="inline" tex="a_{1}=a_{2}" text="a _ 1 = a _ 2" xml:id="S8.p16.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>) such that <Math mode="inline" tex="\Amax(\tilde{D})\cap I_{\om}=[a_{1},a_{2}]" text="[\Amax] * tilde@(D) intersection I _ [\om] = closed-interval@(a _ 1, a _ 2)" xml:id="S8.p16.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\Amax</ERROR>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p16.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.p16.m9.1">
                        <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="closed-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p16.m9.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p16.m9.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p16.m9.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p16.m9.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S8.p17">
        <p>Indeed, because <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}" text="tilde@(D)" xml:id="S8.p17.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is trapping, <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{w}(\tilde{D}_{\om})\subset\tilde{D}_{\om}" text="f _ w * (tilde@(D)) _ [\om] subset-of (tilde@(D)) _ [\om]" xml:id="S8.p17.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p17.m2.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S8.p17.m2.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="\Amax(\tilde{D})\cap I_{\om}=\bigcap_{n\geq 0}f_{w}^{n}(\tilde{D}_{\om})" text="[\Amax] * tilde@(D) intersection I _ [\om] = (intersection _ (n &gt;= 0))@((f _ w) ^ n * (tilde@(D)) _ [\om])" xml:id="S8.p17.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\Amax</ERROR>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.p17.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.p17.m3.1">
                          <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok fontsize="160%" mathstyle="text" meaning="intersection" name="bigcap" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">⋂</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S8.p17.m3.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S8.p17.m3.2">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> which has to be an interval between some attracting fixed points of <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{w}" text="f _ w" xml:id="S8.p17.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Cor}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S8.p18">
      <p>The number of the attracting CBGs is less or equal to <Math mode="inline" tex="\sharp\AFix(f_{w})" text="sharp * [\AFix] * f _ w" xml:id="S8.p18.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="sharp" role="UNKNOWN">♯</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\AFix</ERROR>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p18.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p18.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S8.p19">
      <p>The minimum of <Math mode="inline" tex="\sharp\AFix(f_{w})" text="sharp * [\AFix] * f _ w" xml:id="S8.p19.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok name="sharp" role="UNKNOWN">♯</XMTok>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\AFix</ERROR>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S8.p19.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S8.p19.m1.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, taken over all the periodic sequences <Math mode="inline" tex="(w)" text="w" xml:id="S8.p19.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S8.p19.m2.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p19.m2.1">w</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, is <text class="ltx_emph" font="italic">equal</text> to the number of trapping strips (and thus to the number of the attracting CBGs).</p>
    </para>
<!--  %**** String Line 1025 **** -->    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Sketch of the proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S8.p20">
        <p>First, note that for a generic <Math mode="inline" tex="\om" text="[\om]" xml:id="S8.p20.m1">
            <XMath>
              <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, the intersection of the fiber <Math mode="inline" tex="I_{\om}" text="I _ [\om]" xml:id="S8.p20.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with the trapping strip is contracted exponentially by the dynamics. This is implied by the topological contraction and by the negativity of the Lyapunov exponent. But the skew product is a step one, so this implies that the proportion in the set of all periodic words of period <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S8.p20.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> of words <Math mode="inline" tex="w" text="w" xml:id="S8.p20.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for which the map <Math mode="inline" tex="f_{w}" text="f _ w" xml:id="S8.p20.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">f</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is contracting in <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}\cap I_{(w)}" text="tilde@(D) intersection I _ w" xml:id="S8.p20.m6">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="intersection" name="cap" role="ADDOP">∩</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S8.p20.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p20.m6.1">w</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, tends to 1 as <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S8.p20.m7">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> tends to <Math mode="inline" tex="+\infty" text="+ infinity" xml:id="S8.p20.m8">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMTok meaning="infinity" name="infty" role="ID">∞</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
Hence, for <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S8.p20.m9">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> sufficiently large for most sequences of period <Math mode="inline" tex="n" text="n" xml:id="S8.p20.m10">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> the fiber maps over a period have a single attracting fixed point in <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{D}" text="tilde@(D)" xml:id="S8.p20.m11">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">D</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S8.p21">
        <p>In particular, such <Math mode="inline" tex="\om=(w)" text="[\om] = w" xml:id="S8.p21.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <ERROR class="undefined">\om</ERROR>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S8.p21.m1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S8.p21.m1.1">w</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> exists.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <ERROR class="undefined">{Rem}</ERROR>
    <para xml:id="S8.p22">
      <p>The analogous statements hold for the repelling CBGs.</p>
    </para>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" xml:id="S9">

      <tag>9</tag>

    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">9</tag>Acknowledgements</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">9</tag>Acknowledgements</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S9.p1">
      <p>The authors are very grateful to professor Yu. Ilyashenko for posing the general question about the existence of “thick attractors” which investigation led to the results mentioned above, as well as for fruitful discussions.
The second author would like to thank Université de Rennes 1 and Institut de Recherche Mathematique de Rennes for the hospitality during the initial work on this paper.</p>
    </para>
